English Sentences: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and eschewed evil.
Wolaitta Sentences: Uuxa giyo biittan Iyyooba giyo issi bitanee de7ees; i boree bainnanne suure asa; Xoossaassi yayyidi, iitabaappekka haakkida asa.

English Sentences: And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ayyo laappun attuma naatinne heezzu macca naati yelettidosona.

English Sentences: His substance also was seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she asses, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the men of the east.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aquwaa gidikko, ayyo laappun sha7u dorssati, heezzu sha7u gaameelati, ichchashu xeetu waaxa boorati, ichchashu xeetu macca haretinne keehi daro ashkkarati de7oosona. Arshsho baggaara de7iya asa ubbaappe i aadhdhida dure asa.

English Sentences: And his sons went and feasted in their houses, every one his day; and sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.
Wolaitta Sentences: A attuma naati bantta son bantta son, kayan kayan gibiraa giigissidi, bantta heezzu michcheta banttanaara maanaunne uyanau xeesoosona.

English Sentences: And it was so, when the days of their feasting were gone about, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt offerings according to the number of them all: for Job said, It may be that my sons have sinned, and cursed God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gibiraa gallassati polettido wode, Iyyoobi maallado guuraara denddidi, ba naatu issuwaa issuwaa sunttan xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa yarshshees. I hegaa oottiyoogee, "Ta naati geelladan bantta wozanan Xoossaa qanggidi, nagara oottidaakkonne" giidi hirggido gishshaassa. I eta geeshshanaassi hegaa ubbaton oottees.

English Sentences: Now there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan came also among them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi gallassi kiitanchchati GODAA sinttan beettanau yiidosona; Seexaanaikka qassi etaara yiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Satan, Whence comest thou? Then Satan answered the LORD, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yin GODAI Seexaanaa, "Laa neeni auppe yaadii?" yaagiis. Yaagin Seexaanai GODAAYYO, "Taani sa7an ubban yaanne haanne yuuyiyoosaappenne simerettiyoosaappe yaas" yaagidi zaariis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and escheweth evil?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin GODAI Seexaanaa, "Yaatin, ta ashkkaraa Iyyooba akeekada be7adii? Sa7aa bollan a milatiya boree bainnanne suure asi mulekka baawa. I GODAASSI yayyiya, iitabaappekka haakkida asa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Satan answered the LORD, and said, Doth Job fear God for nought?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Seexaanai, "Tumu Iyyoobi neeyyo coo yayyii?

English Sentences: Hast not thou made an hedge about him, and about his house, and about all that he hath on every side? thou hast blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land.
Wolaitta Sentences: Anne a so asaanne ayyo de7iyaabaa ubbaa neeni dirada naagabeikkii? I oottiyo ooso ubbaa neeni anjjido gishshau, a mehiyaa wudee biittaa ubbaa bollan dariis.

English Sentences: But put forth thine hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will curse thee to thy face.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni ne kushiyaa yeddada, ayyo de7iya aquwaa ubbaa shociyaakko, i nena tumu ne sinttan qanggana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Satan, Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thine hand. So Satan went forth from the presence of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin GODAI Seexaanaa, "Eeno, ayyo de7iyaabai ubbai ne kushiyaana. SHin neeni a bollaa bochchoppa" yaagiis. Hegaappe guyyiyan, Seexaanai GODAA sinttaappe kiyidi biis.

English Sentences: And there was a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother's house:
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi gallassi Iyyooba attuma naatinne macca naati bantta baira ishaa son miiddinne woine eessaa uyiiddi de7oosona.

English Sentences: And there came a messenger unto Job, and said, The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them:
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatishin issi bitanee Iyyoobakko yiidi, "Nuuni boorata waaxidi goyishin, haretikka nu matan maataa miiddi de7ishin,

English Sentences: And the Sabeans fell upon them, and took them away; yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saaba biittaa asati akeekennan yiidi, olaa kessidosona; yaatidi ubbaakka ekki biidosona. Qassi ashkkaratakka qara bisuwan busakkidosona. Yaatin, ta xalaalai attada, ha hanidabaa neeyyo yootanau yaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep, and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: I biron haasayishin, hara bitanee yiidi, "Xoossaa tamai saluwaappe wodhdhidi, dorssatanne dorssata heemmiyaageeta miis. Yaatin, ta xalaalai attada, ha hanidabaa neeyyo yootanau yaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The Chaldeans made out three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have carried them away, yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: I biron haasayishin, hara bitanee yiidi, "Kaladaawetu biittaappe heezzu citan shaahettida ambbaanoti yiidi, nuna olidi, gaameelaa ubbaa ekki biidosona; ashkkaratakka qara bisuwan busakkidosona. Yaatin, ta xalaalai attada, ha hanidabaa neeyyo yootanau yaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother's house:
Wolaitta Sentences: I biron haasayishin, hara bitanee yiidi, "Ne attuma naatinne macca naati bantta baira ishaa son miiddinne woine eessaa uyiiddi de7ishin,

English Sentences: And, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: wolqqaama gotee akeekennan bazzoppe denddidi, keettaa muleera shociis. SHocido keettai eta bolli kunddin, naati haiqqidosona. Yaatin, ta xalaalai attada, ha hanidabaa neeyyo yootanau yaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Job arose, and rent his mantle, and shaved his head, and fell down upon the ground, and worshipped,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Iyyoobi denddidi, kayyuwau ba maayuwaa pooshshiis; ba huuphiyaakka meedettiis. Biittan gufannidi goinniiddi,

English Sentences: And said, Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither: the LORD gave, and the LORD hath taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: hagaadan yaagiis; "Taani ta aayee uluwaappe kallo yelettaas; haiqqiyoodekka taani ekkada biyoobi baawa. GODAI immiis; GODAI zaaridi ekkiis. GODAA sunttai galatetto" yaagiis.

English Sentences: In all this Job sinned not, nor charged God foolishly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha ubbankka Iyyoobi nagaraa oottibeenna; Xoossaa amassalibeenna.

English Sentences: Again there was a day when the sons of God came to present themselves before the LORD, and Satan came also among them to present himself before the LORD.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hara gallassikka qassi kiitanchchati GODAA sinttan beettanau yiidosona; Seexaanaikka qassi etaara issippe a sinttan beettanau yiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Satan, From whence comest thou? And Satan answered the LORD, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yin GODAI Seexaanaa, "Laa neeni auppe yaadii?" yaagiis. Yaagin Seexaanai GODAAYYO, "Taani sa7an ubban yaanne haanne yuuyiyoosaappenne simerettiyoosaappe yaas" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job, that there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and escheweth evil? and still he holdeth fast his integrity, although thou movedst me against him, to destroy him without cause.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin GODAI a, "Ta ashkkaraa Iyyooba akeekada be7adii? Sa7aa bollan a milatiya boree bainnanne suure asi mulekka baawa. I GODAASSI yayyidi, iitabaappekka haakkida asa. Gaasoi bainnan taani a xaissana mala, neeni tana denttettinkka, ha77i gakkanaassi i ba suuretettan minni eqqiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Satan answered the LORD, and said, Skin for skin, yea, all that a man hath will he give for his life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Seexaanai zaaridi GODAA, "Hegee ta mashuwaa ekko! yaagiyoogaadan, asi ba shemppuwaa gishshau, bau de7iyaabaa ubbaa immana.

English Sentences: But put forth thine hand now, and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will curse thee to thy face.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni ne kushiyaa yeddada, a bolla ubbaa ane shoca. Yaatiyaakko i nena tumu ne sinttan qanggana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD said unto Satan, Behold, he is in thine hand; but save his life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin GODAI Seexaanaa, "Eeno, a woroppappe attin, a bolli neeni koyidobaa oottanau danddayaasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So went Satan forth from the presence of the LORD, and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of his foot unto his crown.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Seexaanai GODAA sinttappe kiyidi, Iyyooba tohuwaappe huuphiyaa gakkanaassi iita masunttai a bolli kiyanaadan oottiis.

English Sentences: And he took him a potsherd to scrape himself withal; and he sat down among the ashes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, Iyyoobi bidinttaa bolli uttidi, kon77an bana goodiis.

English Sentences: Then said his wife unto him, Dost thou still retain thine integrity? curse God, and die.
Wolaitta Sentences: A maccaasiyaa a, "Ha77i gakkanaassikka neeni ne suuretettan minna uttadii? Xoossaa qanggada haiqqaaga" yaagaasu.

English Sentences: But he said unto her, Thou speakest as one of the foolish women speaketh. What? shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil? In all this did not Job sin with his lips.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin i zaaridi o, "Neeni eeyya maccaasadan haasayaasa. Nuuni Xoossaappe lo77obaa ekkii ekkidi, iitabaa ekkokkoniiyye?" yaagiis. Ha ubbankka Iyyoobi ba giidoban nagaraa oottibeenna.

English Sentences: Now when Job's three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon him, they came every one from his own place; Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite: for they had made an appointment together to come to mourn with him and to comfort him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyooba laggeti heezzati, Temaana biittaappe Elifaazi, SHuuha biittaappe Bilddaadinne Naa7ima biittaappe Xoofaari Iyyooba bolli gakkida metuwaa siyido wode, ayyo qarettanaunne a minttettanau bantta sooppe bantta sooppe qaagetti ekkidi, issippe akko yiidosona.

English Sentences: And when they lifted up their eyes afar off, and knew him not, they lifted up their voice, and wept; and they rent every one his mantle, and sprinkled dust upon their heads toward heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti a haahuwan eqqidi xeelliyo wode, i Iyyooba gidiyoogaa eribookkona. Guyyeppe a gidiyoogaa erido wode, bantta qaalaa xoqqu oottidi yeekkidosona; bantta maayuwaakka pooshshidi, bantta huuphiyan buhiyaa qolidosona.

English Sentences: So they sat down with him upon the ground seven days and seven nights, and none spake a word unto him: for they saw that his grief was very great.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, eti aara laappun gallassaanne laappun qammaa biittan uttidosona. A sahoi keehi daridoogaa eti be7ido gishshau, ayyo ai asinne qaalanne qaattibeenna.

English Sentences: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Iyyoobi ba doonaa dooyidi,

English Sentences: And Job spake, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: ba yelettido gallassaa hagaadan yaagidi qanggiis;

English Sentences: Let the day perish wherein I was born, and the night in which it was said, There is a man child conceived.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani shahaarettido qammainne taani yelettido gallassai coo xayona!

English Sentences: Let that day be darkness; let not God regard it from above, neither let the light shine upon it.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassai xuma gido! Bolla Xoossai he gallassaa shenehoo go; a bollan poo7oikka poo7oppo.

English Sentences: Let darkness and the shadow of death stain it; let a cloud dwell upon it; let the blackness of the day terrify it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Leelida xumainne ciggaarai a goozo; a shaarai kammo; a poo7uwaakka xumai gentto.

English Sentences: As for that night, let darkness seize upon it; let it not be joined unto the days of the year, let it not come into the number of the months.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassa qammaa sakkana xumai oiqqo. Laitta giddon de7iya gallassatun i qoodettoppo; aginatu qoodankka geloppo.

English Sentences: Lo, let that night be solitary, let no joyful voice come therein.
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassa qammai maino; ufaissa ililssikka an siyettoppo.

English Sentences: Let them curse it that curse the day, who are ready to raise up their mourning.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lewaataana giyo miimminttiyaa denttanau loohida shareechchoti he gallassaa qanggona.

English Sentences: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark; let it look for light, but have none; neither let it see the dawning of the day:
Wolaitta Sentences: He qammaayyo bakkaaliyaa xoolinttee poo7oppo; poo7uwaa naagidikka demmoppo; maallado xalqqeekka ayyo xalqqoppo.

English Sentences: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother's womb, nor hid sorrow from mine eyes.
Wolaitta Sentences: He qammai taani ta aayee uluwan shahaarettennaadaaninne ha metuwaa be7ennaadan teqqibeenna gishshau, qanggettidaagaa gido.

English Sentences: Why died I not from the womb? why did I not give up the ghost when I came out of the belly?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ta aayee uluwan haatta kiyarkkinaashsha! Ta aayee uluwaappe yeletta wodhdhaanne haiqqarkkinaashsha!

English Sentences: Why did the knees prevent me? or why the breasts that I should suck?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta aayyiyaa tana aissi ba kiyuwan zaaradeeshsha? Ba xanttaakka tana aissi xanttadeeshsha?

English Sentences: For now should I have lain still and been quiet, I should have slept: then had I been at rest,
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode taani haiqqidabaa gidiyaakko, ha77i shemppada xiskkaas shin!

English Sentences: With kings and counsellors of the earth, which built desolate places for themselves;
Wolaitta Sentences: Qolettida sohota banttau zaaretti keexxida sa7aa kawotuuranne eta zoriyaageetuura,

English Sentences: Or with princes that had gold, who filled their houses with silver:
Wolaitta Sentences: worqqai de7iyoonne bantta keettan biraa kunttida halaqatuura issippe duufuwan zin77aas shin!

English Sentences: Or as an hidden untimely birth I had not been; as infants which never saw light.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woikko aayee uluwaappe boshettidi yelettida na7adan, woikko gallassa poo7uwaa ainne be7ibeenna yiiraadan, taani biitta giddon qosettaichcharkkinaashsha!

English Sentences: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.
Wolaitta Sentences: Duufuwan iitati bantta iita oosuwaa aggoosona; yan daafuranchchatikka shemppoosona.

English Sentences: There the prisoners rest together; they hear not the voice of the oppressor.
Wolaitta Sentences: He sohuwan qashuwaasatikka shemppidi ufaittoosona; oosuwaa ootissiyaageetu waasuwaa eti hegan siyokkona.

English Sentences: The small and great are there; and the servant is free from his master.
Wolaitta Sentences: Guuttai gitaikka yan de7ees; ailleekka ba godaassi ailletiyoosaappe kiyees.

English Sentences: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, and life unto the bitter in soul;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Metuwan de7iyaageetuyyo poo7oi aissi imettidee? De7oi cammiyoogeetussi,

English Sentences: Which long for death, but it cometh not; and dig for it more than for hid treasures;
Wolaitta Sentences: haiqoi yanddeeshsha giidi amottin, yeennan ixxiyoogeetussi, qotti wottido buquraa koyiyoogaappe aattidi, haiquwaa koyiyaageetussi,

English Sentences: Which rejoice exceedingly, and are glad, when they can find the grave?
Wolaitta Sentences: duufuwaa biidi gakkiyo wode, ufaissaaninne ililssan poocammiyaageetussi de7oi aissi imettidee?

English Sentences: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, and whom God hath hedged in?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ogee bayiichchido uraassi, Xoossai a yuushuwaa dirirggido uraassi poo7oi aissi imettidee?

English Sentences: For my sighing cometh before I eat, and my roarings are poured out like the waters.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qumaa miyoogaa gishshaa oolais; ta oolee aggennan goggiya haattaa mala.

English Sentences: For the thing which I greatly feared is come upon me, and that which I was afraid of is come unto me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani yayyidobai ta bolli gakkiis; taani dagammidobaikka tanan haniis.

English Sentences: I was not in safety, neither had I rest, neither was I quiet; yet trouble came.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taayyo metoppe attin, saroi, woppinne shemppoi baawa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Temaana biittaappe yiida Elifaazi zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: If we assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? but who can withhold himself from speaking?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Issi uri nenaara xalidi haasayikko, neeni lanccuutee? SHin haasayennaaninne agganai oonee?

English Sentences: Behold, thou hast instructed many, and thou hast strengthened the weak hands.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7a, neeni darota tamaarissadasa; arggaacida kushetakka minttettadasa.

English Sentences: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, and thou hast strengthened the feeble knees.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne qaalai xubettidaageeta kaafidi essiis; daafurida gulbbatatakka minttiis.

English Sentences: But now it is come upon thee, and thou faintest; it toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha77i metoi neekko yiis; yin neeni genccabaakka. Metoi nena gakkin, neeni shabbirettadasa.

English Sentences: Is not this thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the uprightness of thy ways?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni Xoossaassi yayyiyoogee nena ammanttidi wottennee? Ne hemettiyo suure hemetai neeyyo hidoota gidennee?

English Sentences: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? or where were the righteous cut off?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ane neeni ha77i qoppa: geeshsha gidida asan xayidai oonee? Woikko suure asi awan xoqollettidi xayi erii?

English Sentences: Even as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, and sow wickedness, reap the same.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani be7idoogaadan, iitatettaa goyidi, metuwaa zeriyaageeti iitatettaanne metuwaa cakkana.

English Sentences: By the blast of God they perish, and by the breath of his nostrils are they consumed.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Xoossaappe kiyiya shemppuwan punettidi bayana; a hanqquwaa peenuqettankka eti meetetti xayana.

English Sentences: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, and the teeth of the young lions, are broken.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitati gudiyaanne daariya gaammotu mala; shin Xoossai eta co77u ootteesinne eta achchaa menttees.

English Sentences: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, and the stout lion's whelps are scattered abroad.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHankkatidi miyoobaa demmibeenna gaammotudan, iitati namisan haiqqoosona; eta naatikka laalettoosona.

English Sentences: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, and mine ear received a little thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Issi gallassi issi xuuri taakko yiis; he xuurai saasukettidi, ta haittan wodhdhiis.

English Sentences: In thoughts from the visions of the night, when deep sleep falleth on men,
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani qammi xiskkuwaa kairidaashin, tana iita aimoi un77ettiis.

English Sentences: Fear came upon me, and trembling, which made all my bones to shake.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana yashshainne kokkorssai oiqqiis; oiqqidi ta meqetta ubbaa gajigajissiis.

English Sentences: Then a spirit passed before my face; the hair of my flesh stood up:
Wolaitta Sentences: Issibai ta som77uwaa pittiiddi, ta sinttaara kanttiis; kanttin dagamaappe denddidaagan ta bollan de7iya beelaalai eqqiis.

English Sentences: It stood still, but I could not discern the form thereof: an image was before mine eyes, there was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: I ta sinttan eqqiis; shin i aibakko taani shaakkada eranau danddayabeikke. Hegaappe guyyiyan, co77u giidasaappe hagaadan yaagiya cenggurssaa siyaas;

English Sentences: Shall mortal man be more just than God? shall a man be more pure than his maker?
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiqqiya asi Xoossaa sinttan xillo gididi beettanau danddayii? Woikko asi bana Medhdhidaagaa sinttan geeshsha gididi beettanau danddayii?

English Sentences: Behold, he put no trust in his servants; and his angels he charged with folly:
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ba ashkkaratun ammanettenna; ba kiitanchchatunkka mooruwaa demmees.

English Sentences: How much less in them that dwell in houses of clay, whose foundation is in the dust, which are crushed before the moth?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, urqqaappe merettidaageetun, eta de7uwaa baasoi baanaa gididoogeetun, bil77aappekka eesuwan haiqqiyaageetun ai keena daro mooroi beettanddeeshsha!

English Sentences: They are destroyed from morning to evening: they perish for ever without any regarding it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Maallado paxa de7iya asi omarssi gakkanaashin, ooninne hassayennan de7ishin haiqqees.

English Sentences: Doth not their excellency which is in them go away? they die, even without wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta de7uwaa xishee shodetti wodhdhiyo wode, eti aadhdhida eratettaa demmennan haiqqi bayoosona yaagiyaagaa siyaas.

English Sentences: Call now, if there be any that will answer thee; and to which of the saints wilt thou turn?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, ane xeesa! SHin oonee neeyyo koyanai? Kiitanchchatuppe ookko simmuutee?

English Sentences: For wrath killeth the foolish man, and envy slayeth the silly one.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya uraa lanccee worees; akeekai paccido uraakka qanaatee xaissees.

English Sentences: I have seen the foolish taking root: but suddenly I cursed his habitation.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya urai minnidi de7iyaagaa taani ta huuphen be7aas; shin sohuwaarakka taani a keettaa qanggaas.

English Sentences: His children are far from safety, and they are crushed in the gate, neither is there any to deliver them.
Wolaitta Sentences: A naati saroi bainnasan de7oosona; eti shilootan, maaddidi haasayiyaabi bainnasan kinchchettidosona.

English Sentences: Whose harvest the hungry eateth up, and taketh it even out of the thorns, and the robber swalloweth up their substance.
Wolaitta Sentences: I shiishshido kattaa namisettidaageeti maana; agunttaa giddon mokkidaagaakka eti ayyo aggokkona. Saamettidaageeti a aquwaa ekkanau hel77oosona.

English Sentences: Although affliction cometh not forth of the dust, neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
Wolaitta Sentences: Tuggai baanaappe kiyenna; metoikka biittaappe mokkenna.

English Sentences: Yet man is born unto trouble, as the sparks fly upward.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tamai piri wodhdhiyoogaadan, asi metuwau yelettiis.

English Sentences: I would seek unto God, and unto God would I commit my cause:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Tana gidiyaakko, taani Xoossaakko shiiqana; ta mootuwaakka a sinttan wottana.

English Sentences: Which doeth great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
Wolaitta Sentences: Gidduwaa pilggidi eranau danddayettenna gitabatanne qoodi bainna oorattabata Xoossai oottees.

English Sentences: Who giveth rain upon the earth, and sendeth waters upon the fields:
Wolaitta Sentences: Iraa biittan bukissees; gadiyaukka haattaa yeddees.

English Sentences: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ziqqi giidaageeta xoqqu xoqqu oottees; kayyottiyaageetakka minttettidi ufaissees.

English Sentences: He disappointeth the devices of the crafty, so that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
Wolaitta Sentences: Genanchchatu halchchuwaakka halissees; hegaa gishshau, eta kushiyaa oosoi polettenna.

English Sentences: He taketh the wise in their own craftiness: and the counsel of the froward is carried headlong.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchchata i eta geniyan oiqqees; geellatu maqquwaakka aatti yeggees.

English Sentences: They meet with darkness in the day time, and grope in the noonday as in the night.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etau gallassai xumana; gallassa seetankka eti henqqeleela bilahiyaadan tattaafana.

English Sentences: But he saveth the poor from the sword, from their mouth, and from the hand of the mighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesata i eta morkketu bisuwaappe ashshees; i eta wolqqaamatu kushiyaappekka wotti ekkees.

English Sentences: So the poor hath hope, and iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, hiyyeesatuyyo hidootai de7ees; iita asata i co77u oottees.

English Sentences: Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth: therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai seeriyo uri anjjettidaagaa; hegaa gishshau, Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa seeraa karoppa.

English Sentences: For he maketh sore, and bindeth up: he woundeth, and his hands make whole.
Wolaitta Sentences: I masunxxissees, shin masunttaa qachchees. I dechchees, shin a kushee xallees.

English Sentences: He shall deliver thee in six troubles: yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Usuppun qommo metobaappe i nena ashshana; laappunttikka nena bochchenna.

English Sentences: In famine he shall redeem thee from death: and in war from the power of the sword.
Wolaitta Sentences: Koshaa wode haiquwaappe, olaa wodekka bisuwaa qaraappe i nena ashshana.

English Sentences: Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue: neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
Wolaitta Sentences: I nena inxxarssaa lissuwaappe genttana; bashshai gakkiyo wodekka yayyakka.

English Sentences: At destruction and famine thou shalt laugh: neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bashshaa bollinne koshaa bolli neeni miiccana; bazzo do7atuyyookka yayyakka.

English Sentences: For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field: and the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne goyiyo goshshan shuchchi de7enna; bazzo do7atikka nenaara saro gidana.

English Sentences: And thou shalt know that thy tabernacle shall be in peace; and thou shalt visit thy habitation, and shalt not sin.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne dunkkaanee saro gidiyoogaa neeni geeshshada erana; ne dorssatu birddiyaakka neeni xomoosiyo wode, etappe issoinne paccenna.

English Sentences: Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great, and thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne yeletai corattanaagaanne ne zerettatikka dembbaa maataa keena gidanaagaa neeni erana.

English Sentences: Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age, like as a shock of corn cometh in in his season.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gisttiyaa mirqqee ba wodiyan audiyaa yiyoogaadan, neeni adda cimada, duufuwaa baana.

English Sentences: Lo this, we have searched it, so it is; hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobaa, nuuni hagaa ubbaa pilggi xeellida. Hegee tuma gidiyo gishshau, hegaa siyada, neeyyo ekka" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But Job answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Iyyoobi zaaridi,

English Sentences: Oh that my grief were throughly weighed, and my calamity laid in the balances together!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta waayeenne ta azzanoi ubbai meezaanan likketteerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: For now it would be heavier than the sand of the sea: therefore my words are swallowed up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatiyaakko abbaa doona shafiyaappekka aadhdhi deexxana. Hegaa gishshau, ta qaalai xala gidiis.

English Sentences: For the arrows of the Almighty are within me, the poison whereof drinketh up my spirit: the terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa wonddafiyaa zubbeti tana caddidosona; ta bollaikka eta yiishshaa uyees. Xoossaa dagamai ta bolli salppiis.

English Sentences: Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass? or loweth the ox over his fodder?
Wolaitta Sentences: Haree maatai a sinttan de7ishin caaggiiyye? Woikko boorai phachchaa demmidi xaaggiiyye?

English Sentences: Can that which is unsavoury be eaten without salt? or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
Wolaitta Sentences: Mal77ennabi maxinee gelennan meetettiiyye? Woikko phuuphulle giddo haattai laqilaqiiyye?

English Sentences: The things that my soul refused to touch are as my sorrowful meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa mala qumaa taani shenetais; hegaa mala qumaa miikko, tana sakkees.

English Sentences: Oh that I might have my request; and that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani woossido woosai gakkeerenneeshsha! Xoossaikka ta wozanaa amuwaa immeerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: Even that it would please God to destroy me; that he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai tana woreerenneeshsha! I ba kushiyaa yeddidi, ta de7uwaa turaa duutteerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: Then should I yet have comfort; yea, I would harden myself in sorrow: let him not spare; for I have not concealed the words of the Holy One.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Geeshsha Xoossaa qaalaa kaddabeenna gishshau, taayyo seelai darikkonne, ta haiqoi tana minttettees.

English Sentences: What is my strength, that I should hope? and what is mine end, that I should prolong my life?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani paxa de7anau taayyo aiba wolqqi de7ii? Taani danddayanau, ta wurssettai aibee?

English Sentences: Is my strength the strength of stones? or is my flesh of brass?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta wolqqai shuchchaa wolqqaa malee? Woikko ta ashoi nahaase birataa malee?

English Sentences: Is not my help in me? and is wisdom driven quite from me?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani tana maaddanau aiba wolqqinne taayyo baawa; maado demmanau taani biyoosikka de7enna.

English Sentences: To him that is afflicted pity should be shewed from his friend; but he forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Metuwan de7iya uri Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaassi yayyiyoogaa aggiyaakkokka, a laggeti ayyo kehatettaa bessanau koshshees.

English Sentences: My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook, and as the stream of brooks they pass away;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta ishatoo, intte irai bukkenna wode meliya shaafaa mala, tana cimmeeta.

English Sentences: Which are blackish by reason of the ice, and wherein the snow is hid:
Wolaitta Sentences: Balggo aginatun he shaafai ordde shachchaaninne suuppa shachchan kumees.

English Sentences: What time they wax warm, they vanish: when it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin bonee gakkiyo wode, he shachchai seeridi, haatta kiyees; haattaikka he sohuwaappe xayees.

English Sentences: The paths of their way are turned aside; they go to nothing, and perish.
Wolaitta Sentences: Caana mehiyaa laaggidi biya zal77anchchati haatta koyanau bantta ogiyaappe gaxi kiyidi, bazzuwan toilattiiddi, haiqqi xayoosona.

English Sentences: The troops of Tema looked, the companies of Sheba waited for them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Teema biittaa zal77anchchatinne Saaba biittaa manddarati haattaa demmana giidi, koshshaa buusidosona.

English Sentences: They were confounded because they had hoped; they came thither, and were ashamed.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eti ammanettidi koyin xayido gishshau, yeellatidosonanne hidootaa qanxxidosona.

English Sentences: For now ye are nothing; ye see my casting down, and are afraid.
Wolaitta Sentences: Inttekka taayyo he shaafatu mala gidideta; tana gakkida metuwaa be7idi yayyideta.

English Sentences: Did I say, Bring unto me? or, Give a reward for me of your substance?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani inttena, Taayyo issibaa immite woikko, Intte aquwaappe ta gishshaa asassi mattaayiyaa immite giidanaa?

English Sentences: Or, Deliver me from the enemy's hand? or, Redeem me from the hand of the mighty?
Wolaitta Sentences: Woikko, Tana ta morkkiyaa kushiyaappe ashshite woikko, Huqqunniyaageetu kushiyaappe tana wozite giidanaa?

English Sentences: Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte tana tamaarissite; taani co77u gaana. Taani ai mooridaakko, ane tana bessite.

English Sentences: How forcible are right words! but what doth your arguing reprove?
Wolaitta Sentences: Tuma gidida qaali caddees! SHin intte taayyo odiyo seerai ubbai tana ainne maaddenna.

English Sentences: Do ye imagine to reprove words, and the speeches of one that is desperate, which are as wind?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte taani haasayiyo haasayaa carkko mala giidi qoppeeta. Yaatin, taani hidoota qanxxada haasayiyo haasayaa aissi qoreetii?

English Sentences: Yea, ye overwhelm the fatherless, and ye dig a pit for your friend.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aawai bainnaageeta shaakki ekkanau intte saamaa yeggeeta; intte laggiyaakka baizzanau washisseeta.

English Sentences: Now therefore be content, look upon me; for it is evident unto you if I lie.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ane tishshi oottidi, tana xeellite. Taani intte sinttan wordduwaa haasayikke.

English Sentences: Return, I pray you, let it not be iniquity; yea, return again, my righteousness is in it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hayyanintta, ane zaarettidi qoppite; taani xillo gidiyo gishshau, ta bolli coo pirddoppite.

English Sentences: Is there iniquity in my tongue? cannot my taste discern perverse things?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ta inxxarssan worddotidobaa milatii? Ta doonai wordduwaanne tumaa shaakkidi haasayanau danddayennee?

English Sentences: Is there not an appointed time to man upon earth? are not his days also like the days of an hireling?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asa de7oi sa7aa bollan wolqqaama baaxe gidenneeyye? A de7o laittai keraa oottiya asa de7o laittaa mala gidenneeyye?

English Sentences: As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, and as an hireling looketh for the reward of his work:
Wolaitta Sentences: Kuwaa amottiya ashkkaraadan, woikko ba damoozaa ekkanau naagiya oosanchchaadan,

English Sentences: So am I made to possess months of vanity, and wearisome nights are appointed to me.
Wolaitta Sentences: hegaadan taayyo mela aginatinne tugga qammati imettidosona.

English Sentences: When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? and I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani zin77iyo wode, Aude beegottanddinaashsha? yaagais. SHin qammai taayyo aduqqees; sa7ai wonttana gakkanaassi hiixan aadhdha aadhdha wodhdhais.

English Sentences: My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; my skin is broken, and become loathsome.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta bollai guxuniyaanne googuwaa maayiis; ta masunttaappe giishshai goggees.

English Sentences: My days are swifter than a weaver's shuttle, and are spent without hope.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta laittai shimainniyaa muhuuhaappekka aadhdhi eesotees; aiba hidootinne bainnan ta laittai wurees.

English Sentences: O remember that my life is wind: mine eye shall no more see good.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abeet Xoossau, ta laittai siiriyaara shemppiyo issi shemppo mala gidiyoogaa hassaya! Ta aifee naa77antto kehabaa be7ennan attiis.

English Sentences: The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no more: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni tana ha77i be7aasa; shin naa77antto be7akka; neeni tana koyikko, taani xayaichchana.

English Sentences: As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: so he that goeth down to the grave shall come up no more.
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHaarai piskki giidi xayiyoogaadan, duufuwaa wodhdhida uri simmidi kiyenna.

English Sentences: He shall return no more to his house, neither shall his place know him any more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba sookka naa77antto simmidi yeenna; a eriya asaikka a dogees.

English Sentences: Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, taani co77u giikke; taani ta tuggaa gishshau haasayana; ta de7oi cammido gishshau zuuzummana.

English Sentences: Am I a sea, or a whale, that thou settest a watch over me?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagaa keenaa neeni tana aissi naagai? Taani neeyyo abba woikko abba giddo miimmintte gaadiiyye?

English Sentences: When I say, My bed shall comfort me, my couch shall ease my complaint;
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani, Ta hiixai tana minttettanddeeshsha; ta alggaikka tana zuuzunttaappe shemppissanddeeshsha! yaagiyo wode,

English Sentences: Then thou scarest me with dreams, and terrifiest me through visions:
Wolaitta Sentences: neeni tana aimuwan yashissaasa; ajjuutankka tana daganttaasa.

English Sentences: So that my soul chooseth strangling, and death rather than my life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ha sakkiya bollaara de7anaagaappe sulettiyoogaanne haiqqiyoogaa doorais.

English Sentences: I loathe it; I would not live alway: let me alone; for my days are vanity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ta de7uwaa karaas; taani merinau de7anau koyikke. Ta laittai siiriyaara shemppiyo issi shemppo mala gidiyo gishshau, neeni tana agga baya.

English Sentences: What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him? and that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni a gitabaadan xeellanau asi aibee? Neeni abaa aissi ezggai?

English Sentences: And that thou shouldest visit him every morning, and try him every moment?
Wolaitta Sentences: Maallado maallado neeni a xomoosaasa; qassi daqiiqan daqiiqan a paaccaasa.

English Sentences: How long wilt thou not depart from me, nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni taakko xeelliyoogaa mulekka aggikkii? Woikko taani ta cuchchaa mittiyo wodiyaakka taayyo immikkii?

English Sentences: I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, so that I am a burden to myself?
Wolaitta Sentences: Abeet asa wochchiyaagoo, taani nagaraa oottidaba gidikko, nena aibi qohidee? Neeni aissi tana caddi kaa7iyoobaa oottadii? Neeyyo taani deexo tooho gididanaayye?

English Sentences: And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, and take away mine iniquity? for now shall I sleep in the dust; and thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I shall not be.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta balaappe aissi tana maarennan ixxai? Ta nagaraakka aissi atto geennan aggai? Simmi taani duufuwaa wodhdhiyo wodee gakkiis; neeni tana koyiyo wodekka, taani beettikke" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, SHuuha biittaappe yiida Bilddaadi zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: How long wilt thou speak these things? and how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a strong wind?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni hagaa malabaa aude gakkanaassi haasayuutee? Ne doonaappe kiyiya qaalai wolqqaama gote mala.

English Sentences: Doth God pervert judgment? or doth the Almighty pervert justice?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai pirddaanne xillobaa geellayii?

English Sentences: If thy children have sinned against him, and he have cast them away for their transgression;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne naati Xoossaa bolli nagaraa oottido gishshau, i eta etau bessiyaagaadan qaxxayiis.

English Sentences: If thou wouldest seek unto God betimes, and make thy supplication to the Almighty;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni Xoossaakko simmikko, Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa woossikko,

English Sentences: If thou wert pure and upright; surely now he would awake for thee, and make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
Wolaitta Sentences: neeni geeshshanne suure gidikko, i ne gishshau denddidi, nena maaddana; i kase ne de7uwau zaaridi woitana.

English Sentences: Though thy beginning was small, yet thy latter end should greatly increase.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne doomettai guutta milatikkonne, ne wurssettai keehippe darana.

English Sentences: For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Kase yeletaa ane oichcha; oichchada nu maizza aawati ai ai tamaaridaakko, qorada demma.

English Sentences: (For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing, because our days upon earth are a shadow:)
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, nuuni zino yelettidaageeta; nuuni aibanne erokko. Nuuni ha sa7an de7iyo laittai kuwaa mala.

English Sentences: Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee, and utter words out of their heart?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti nena tamaarissona, neeyyo yootonanne bantta akeekidobaappe haasayona.

English Sentences: Can the rush grow up without mire? can the flag grow without water?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ceeccai caree bainnasan diccanau danddayenna; maqaikka haatti bainnasan mokkanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: Whilst it is yet in his greenness, and not cut down, it withereth before any other herb.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biron dicciiddi, qanxxettennan de7iiddi, maataappekka eesuwan shullana.

English Sentences: So are the paths of all that forget God; and the hypocrite's hope shall perish:
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa dogiya asaa ubbaa wurssettai hegaa mala; Xoossai bainna uraa hidootaikka xayana.

English Sentences: Whose hope shall be cut off, and whose trust shall be a spider's web.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ammanettiyoobai meqqiichchiyaabaa; i ceeqettiyoobaikka shararootiyaa keettaa mala.

English Sentences: He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand: he shall hold it fast, but it shall not endure.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba shararoote keettan zemppees, shin eqqenna; i a oiqqana, shin a danddayenna.

English Sentences: He is green before the sun, and his branch shooteth forth in his garden.
Wolaitta Sentences: I awan haattaa ushshido ataakilttiyaa mala; ataakilttiyaa sohuwaa pinni kiyana gakkanau daayees.

English Sentences: His roots are wrapped about the heap, and seeth the place of stones.
Wolaitta Sentences: Keela shuchchaa yuushuwan ba xaphuwaa yeddees; shuchchatu giddonkka baayyo sohuwaa koyees.

English Sentences: If he destroy him from his place, then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i ba sohuwaappe shodetti xayiyaakko, he sohoi a, Taani nena be7abeikke yaagana.

English Sentences: Behold, this is the joy of his way, and out of the earth shall others grow.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7a, iita asatu ufaissai hagaa mala. Aissi giikko, hara asati yiidi, eta sohuwaa oiqqoosona.

English Sentences: Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man, neither will he help the evil doers:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai tumaappe boree bainna asa oli aggenna; iitaa oottiyaageeta qassi maaddenna.

English Sentences: Till he fill thy mouth with laughing, and thy lips with rejoicing.
Wolaitta Sentences: I zaaridi, nena miicissananne ililissana.

English Sentences: They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame; and the dwelling place of the wicked shall come to nought.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena ixxiyaageeti yeellaa maayana; iitatu keettai xayana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Job answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Iyyoobi zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: I know it is so of a truth: but how should man be just with God?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ee, hagee intte giyoogee tuma gidiyoogaa taani erais. SHin asi Xoossaa sinttan xillo gidanau waani danddayii?

English Sentences: If he will contend with him, he cannot answer him one of a thousand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aara issi uri palamettanau koyikko, he urai i oichchiyo sha7u oishaappe issuwaanne zaaranau danddayenna.

English Sentences: He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength: who hath hardened himself against him, and hath prospered?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ba wozanan aadhdhida eranchcha; ba abbiyankka daro wolqqaama. Aara eqettanau danddayiya ooninne baawa.

English Sentences: Which removeth the mountains, and they know not: which overturneth them in his anger.
Wolaitta Sentences: Erennan de7ishin, xoqqa dereta i eta sohuwaappe diggees; ba hanqquwankka aatti yeggees.

English Sentences: Which shaketh the earth out of her place, and the pillars thereof tremble.
Wolaitta Sentences: I biittaa a sohuwan qaattees; biittaa tuuqetakka yaaqiyaaqissees.

English Sentences: Which commandeth the sun, and it riseth not; and sealeth up the stars.
Wolaitta Sentences: Awai awaxxennaadaaninne xoolintteti poo7ennaadan azazanau danddayees.

English Sentences: Which alone spreadeth out the heavens, and treadeth upon the waves of the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: I barkka salota micciis; abbaa beetaa bollikka hemettees.

English Sentences: Which maketh Arcturus, Orion, and Pleiades, and the chambers of the south.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai Wogga Beeriyaa giyo xoolinttetu citaa, Ooriyoona giyo xoolinttetu citaa, Piliyaadisa giyo xoolinttetu citaanne tohossa baggaara de7iya xoolinttetu citata medhdhidaagaa.

English Sentences: Which doeth great things past finding out; yea, and wonders without number.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gidduwaa pilggidi eranau danddayettenna gitabata, qoodi bainna oorattabata i oottees.

English Sentences: Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not: he passeth on also, but I perceive him not.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai taakko shiiqiyaakkokka, taani a be7anau danddayikke; i ta lanqqeera kanttiyaakkokka, taani i hegan de7iyoogaa eranau danddayikke.

English Sentences: Behold, he taketh away, who can hinder him? who will say unto him, What doest thou?
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba koyidobaa ekkin, a ooninne digganau danddayenna. Waatai? yaagidi a oichchana asi baawa.

English Sentences: If God will not withdraw his anger, the proud helpers do stoop under him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ba hanqquwaa teqqenna; Ra7aaba giyo miimminttiyaa maaddiya ba morkketa ba tohuwaappe garssau aattidi yedhdhees.

English Sentences: How much less shall I answer him, and choose out my words to reason with him?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaatin, taani a oishaa zaaranau lo77o qaalaa auppe demmanau danddayiyaanaa?

English Sentences: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer, but I would make supplication to my judge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani xillo gidiyaakkokka, pirddiya Xoossai tana maaranaadan woossanaappe attin, taani a bolli zaarikke.

English Sentences: If I had called, and he had answered me; yet would I not believe that he had hearkened unto my voice.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani a xeesin, i taayyo koyiyaakkokka, Ta cenggurssaa siyiis gaada ammanikke.

English Sentences: For he breaketh me with a tempest, and multiplieth my wounds without cause.
Wolaitta Sentences: I tana gotiyan mentterettees; gaasoi bainnan i ta masunttaa darissees.

English Sentences: He will not suffer me to take my breath, but filleth me with bitterness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana shemppuwaakka shemppissennan diggees; i ta de7uwaa camettees.

English Sentences: If I speak of strength, lo, he is strong: and if of judgment, who shall set me a time to plead?
Wolaitta Sentences: Wolqqaabaa haasayikko, i wolqqaama. Pirddaabaa haasayikko, a xeesidi, pirdda keetti shiishshana asi baawa.

English Sentences: If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani xillo gidiyaakkonne ta doonai tana mooranchcha kessees; taani boree bainna asa gidiyaakkonne, i tana geella kessees.

English Sentences: Though I were perfect, yet would I not know my soul: I would despise my life.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani boree bainna asa. SHin ta de7uwaa wudikke; taani ta de7uwaa karais.

English Sentences: This is one thing, therefore I said it, He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dummatetti baawa; hegaa gishshau, taani, I boree bainnaageetanne iitata naa77aakka issippe xaissees yaagais.

English Sentences: If the scourge slay suddenly, he will laugh at the trial of the innocent.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bashshai xillo asata qoppennan woriyo wode, Xoossai qilliiccees.

English Sentences: The earth is given into the hand of the wicked: he covereth the faces of the judges thereof; if not, where, and who is he?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ha sa7aa iita asatuyyo aattidi immiis; pirddiyaageetu aifiyaakka gooziis. Hagaa ubbaa oottidai a gidanaappe attin, harai oonee?

English Sentences: Now my days are swifter than a post: they flee away, they see no good.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta de7o laittati wottaa woxxiya uraappekka aadhdhidi eesotoosona; eti lo77obaa be7ennan paallidi xayoosona.

English Sentences: They are passed away as the swift ships: as the eagle that hasteth to the prey.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta de7o laittati maqqaa wolwolotudan eesotoosona; argganttai bau miyoobaa oiqqanau saluwaappe duge paalliyoogaadan paalloosona.

English Sentences: If I say, I will forget my complaint, I will leave off my heaviness, and comfort myself:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani, Ta zuuzunttaa dogana; ta som77uwaakka xumissiyoogaa aggada pashkkana yaagikko,

English Sentences: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.
Wolaitta Sentences: tana gakkana waaye ubbaassi taani yayyais; aissi giikko, neeni tana geeshsha geennaagaa taani erais.

English Sentences: If I be wicked, why then labour I in vain?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, taani mooranchcha gidaichchaappe attin, coo mela aissi daafuriyaanaa?

English Sentences: If I wash myself with snow water, and make my hands never so clean;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ta bollaa harai atto saamunan meecettiyaakkokka,

English Sentences: Yet shalt thou plunge me in the ditch, and mine own clothes shall abhor me.
Wolaitta Sentences: neeni tana urqqa ollan olana; olin ta maayoikka tana shenetana.

English Sentences: For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him, and we should come together in judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ayyo zaaruwaa immana gaanau, Xoossai ta mala asa gidenna. Gididaakko nuuni naa77ai daanna sintti aadhdhana;

English Sentences: Neither is there any daysman betwixt us, that might lay his hand upon us both.
Wolaitta Sentences: shin ba kushiyaa nu naa77aa bolli wottidi, nuna sigettiya asi nu giddon de7eerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: Let him take his rod away from me, and let not his fear terrify me:
Wolaitta Sentences: Abeet Xoossau, tana qaxxayiyoogaa agga; tana daganttiyoogaanne yashissiyoogaa agga.

English Sentences: Then would I speak, and not fear him; but it is not so with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatikko, taani neeyyo yayyennan haasayana; shin ha77i danddayikke.

English Sentences: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ta de7uwaa karais! Hegaa gishshau, taani mootettanaappe attin, co77u giikke; taani mishettada haasayais.

English Sentences: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; shew me wherefore thou contendest with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Xoossaa hagaadan yaagais: Hai ta bolli pirddoppa; neeni tana mootiyo mootoi aibakkonne taayyo yoota.

English Sentences: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, that thou shouldest despise the work of thine hands, and shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni tana huqqunnanau bessii? Neeni ne kushiyan medhdhido uraa kariyoogee, qassi iitatu halchchuwaa polissiyoogee lo77oo?

English Sentences: Hast thou eyes of flesh? or seest thou as man seeth?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aifee asa aife malee? Asi xeelliyoogaadan neeni xeellai?

English Sentences: Are thy days as the days of man? are thy years as man's days,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne de7o laittaikka asa de7o laittaa keenee?

English Sentences: That thou enquirest after mine iniquity, and searchest after my sin?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, ta mooruwaa aissi koyai? Ta nagaraakka aissi qorai?

English Sentences: Thou knowest that I am not wicked; and there is none that can deliver out of thine hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani mooranchcha gidennaagaanne ne kushiyaappe tana ooninne ashshanau danddayennaagaa neeni eraasa.

English Sentences: Thine hands have made me and fashioned me together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Tana ne kushee giigissidi medhdhiis; shin ha77i he kushee simmidi, tana xaissees.

English Sentences: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast made me as the clay; and wilt thou bring me into dust again?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni tana urqqaappe medhdhidoogaa hassaya. Yaatin, ha77i tana baanaadan liiqissanau hanai?

English Sentences: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, and curdled me like cheese?
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana maattadan ta aayee uluwan tigidaageenne dichchidaagee nena.

English Sentences: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, and hast fenced me with bones and sinews.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana neeni ashuwaanne gogaa maizzadasa; ta meqettaa xaphuwaara gattada waaxadasa.

English Sentences: Thou hast granted me life and favour, and thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni taayyo de7uwaanne aggenna ne siiquwaa immadasa; ne naaguwan neeni tana paxa wottadasa.

English Sentences: And these things hast thou hid in thine heart: I know that this is with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin neeni he wodeppe doommada, ne wozanaa giddon tana qohanau qoppiyoogaa taani erais.

English Sentences: If I sin, then thou markest me, and thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani nagaraa oottikko be7anau, neeni tana wochchaasa; ta mooruwaakka atto gaakka.

English Sentences: If I be wicked, woe unto me; and if I be righteous, yet will I not lift up my head. I am full of confusion; therefore see thou mine affliction;
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani mooranchcha gidikko, taayyo aayye7ana! Qassi taani xillo gidiyaakkokka, ta huuphiyaa pude xoqqu oottanau danddayikke. Aissi giikko, neeni tana yeellan kuntta wottadasanne tuggan mattoya wottadasa.

English Sentences: For it increaseth. Thou huntest me as a fierce lion: and again thou shewest thyself marvellous upon me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani otorettikko, neeni tana gaammodan yedettada oiqqana; oiqqada qassikka tana qohanau, ne maalaalissiya oosuwaa neeni oottana.

English Sentences: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, and increasest thine indignation upon me; changes and war are against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ta bolli ooratta markkata ehaasa; ne hanqquwaakka ta bolli darissaasa; tana olanau ooratta halchchota giigissaasa.

English Sentences: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaatin, tana ta aayee uluwaappe aissi kessadii? Ooninne tana be7ennan haiqqarkkinaashsha!

English Sentences: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani de7ennan aggarkkinaashsha! Woikko ta aayee uluwaappe kiyosaara duufuwan wodhdharkkinaashsha!

English Sentences: Are not my days few? cease then, and let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta de7anau attida laittati guutta gidokkonaa? Taani qiibaa ufaitta ekkana mala, hai tana aggarkkii!

English Sentences: Before I go whence I shall not return, even to the land of darkness and the shadow of death;
Wolaitta Sentences: Leelida xuma sohuwaa taani biyo wodee matiis; taani hegaappe simmada haa yiikke.

English Sentences: A land of darkness, as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death, without any order, and where the light is as darkness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani biyo sohoi sakkana xumainne cabboi de7iyo biitta; hegan de7iya poo7oikka xumaa mala" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Naa7ima biittaappe yiida Xoofaari zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Should not the multitude of words be answered? and should a man full of talk be justified?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha haasayettida qaalau ubbau zaaro immiya asi baawee? Woikko hagaa haasayida bitanee tumanchcha gidanau danddayii?

English Sentences: Should thy lies make men hold their peace? and when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne mela haasayai asaa co77u oottii? Neeni qilliicciyo wode, nena seeriyaabi baawa gaadiiyye?

English Sentences: For thou hast said, My doctrine is pure, and I am clean in thine eyes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni odaidda, Ta timirttee tuma; taani Xoossaa sinttan geeshsha yaagaasa.

English Sentences: But oh that God would speak, and open his lips against thee;
Wolaitta Sentences: Wai ana, Xoossai ne bolli ba doonaa dooyidi haasayeerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: And that he would shew thee the secrets of wisdom, that they are double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.
Wolaitta Sentences: I neeyyo aadhdhida eratettaa xuuraa qonccisseerenneeshsha! Aissi giikko, tumu aadhdhida eratettaassi daro kifileti de7oosona. Xoossai nena ne oottido nagaraa keenaa qaxxayibeennaagaa era.

English Sentences: Canst thou by searching find out God? canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni Xoossaa ciimma xuuraa qorada eranau danddayai? Woikko Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa zawata koyada demmanau danddayai?

English Sentences: It is as high as heaven; what canst thou do? deeper than hell; what canst thou know?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti salotuppekka xoqqa; neeni ainne oottanau danddayakka. Eti Si7ooliyaappekka aadhdhida ciimma; neeni eranau danddayakka.

English Sentences: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa aadhdhida eratettai biittaa zananaappe aduqqees; abbaa gomppaappekka aakkees.

English Sentences: If he cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder him?
Wolaitta Sentences: I yiidi, nena qasho keettan yeggiyaakkonne pirdda keetti shiishshiyaakko, a digganau danddayiyai oonee?

English Sentences: For he knoweth vain men: he seeth wickedness also; will he not then consider it?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai pattenna asata erees; iitabaa be7iyo wode, i coo aggenna.

English Sentences: For vain man would be wise, though man be born like a wild ass's colt.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eeyya asai aadhdhida eranchcha gidiyoogaappe harddiidiyaa asa yeliyoogee matees.

English Sentences: If thou prepare thine heart, and stretch out thine hands toward him;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, neeni ne wozanaa suure oottikko, ne kushiyaakka akko miccada woossikko,

English Sentences: If iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.
Wolaitta Sentences: nagaraa ne kushiyaappe haassikko, ne keettankka iitabai de7ennaadan oottikko,

English Sentences: For then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:
Wolaitta Sentences: yaatikko, neeni xoqqu gaada yeellai bainnan ubbabaa xeellana; yashshiyaabi bainnankka minnada eqqana.

English Sentences: Because thou shalt forget thy misery, and remember it as waters that pass away:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne metuwaa ubbaakka neeni dogana; gukkida haattaadan, neeni a naa77antto hassayakka.

English Sentences: And thine age shall be clearer than the noonday: thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne de7oi seetaa awaappekka aadhdhidi poo7ana; ne de7uwaa xumaikka maallado poo7uwaa mala gidana.

English Sentences: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest in safety.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeyyo hidootai de7iyo gishshau, neeni hirggennan de7ana. Xoossai nena naagiyo gishshau, neeni woppu gaananne shemppana.

English Sentences: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; yea, many shall make suit unto thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni xiskkiyo wode, nena yashissana uri baawa; daroti nena auddashana.

English Sentences: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall not escape, and their hope shall be as the giving up of the ghost.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin iitati metuwaa be7idikka akeekokkona; appe baqati attanaukka danddayokkona. Etau haiqoppe attin, hara hidooti de7enna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And Job answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Iyyoobi zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: No doubt but ye are the people, and wisdom shall die with you.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hayyanintta, intte tumukka asa; aadhdhida eratetta ubbaikka inttenaara haiqqana!

English Sentences: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: yea, who knoweth not such things as these?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taukka intteegaadan akeekai de7ees; taani intteppe laafikke! Ha intte haasayidobaa ubbaa ooninne erees.

English Sentences: I am as one mocked of his neighbour, who calleth upon God, and he answereth him: the just upright man is laughed to scorn.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani Xoossaa woossin, i siyido asa gidikkonne, ta laggetuyyo miicciyoobaa kiyaas; taani xillonne boree bainna asa gidikkokka, qilliicciyoobaa kiyaas.

English Sentences: He that is ready to slip with his feet is as a lamp despised in the thought of him that is at ease.
Wolaitta Sentences: Inttena aiba metoinne gakkibeenna gishshau, ta metuwaa kareeta; kunddanau ganddigaariya bitaniyaakka sugeeta.

English Sentences: The tabernacles of robbers prosper, and they that provoke God are secure; into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bonqqiyaageetu keettati saro de7oosona; Xoossaa yiilloyiyaageetikka hirggi bainnan de7oosona. Eta kushiyaa wolqqai eti goinniyo xoossa.

English Sentences: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; and the fowls of the air, and they shall tell thee:
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin neeni ane meheta oichcha; eti nena tamaarissana. Woikko saluwaa kafota oichcha; eti neeyyo yootana.

English Sentences: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee: and the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woikko sa7aara gooshettiya meretati nena tamaarissana; abbaa moletikka neeyyo odana.

English Sentences: Who knoweth not in all these that the hand of the LORD hath wrought this?
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAA kushee hagaa oottidoogaa hageetu ubbaa giddon erennai oonee?

English Sentences: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, and the breath of all mankind.
Wolaitta Sentences: Paxa de7iya meretatu ubbaa de7oinne asa ubbaa shemppoi a kushiyaana.

English Sentences: Doth not the ear try words? and the mouth taste his meat?
Wolaitta Sentences: Inxxarssai qumaa shaakki eriyoogaadan, haittai haasayaa shaakkidi erenneeyye?

English Sentences: With the ancient is wisdom; and in length of days understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Aadhdhida eratettai cimida asatu matan de7ees; daro wodiyaa de7iyoogee akeekaa immees.

English Sentences: With him is wisdom and strength, he hath counsel and understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaassi aadhdhida eratettainne wolqqai de7ees; zoreenne akeekai an beettees.

English Sentences: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again: he shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai qolidobaa zaaretti keexxanai oonee? I qachchido uraakka birshshi yeddanai oonee?

English Sentences: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up: also he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai iraa teqqikko, biittai melees; i iraa bukissikko, di7oi biittaa bashshees.

English Sentences: With him is strength and wisdom: the deceived and the deceiver are his.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Minotettainne xoonoi Xoossaagaa; cimettiyaageenne cimmiyaageenne naa77aikka appe garssaara de7oosona.

English Sentences: He leadeth counsellors away spoiled, and maketh the judges fools.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zoriyaageetuppe i aadhdhida eraa qaari ekkees; halaqatakka i gooshshees.

English Sentences: He looseth the bond of kings, and girdeth their loins with a girdle.
Wolaitta Sentences: I kawota kawotaa araataappe wottees; wottidi ailleta kessees.

English Sentences: He leadeth princes away spoiled, and overthroweth the mighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qeesetuppekka bonchchuwaa qaari ekkees; wolqqaamatakka aatti yeggees.

English Sentences: He removeth away the speech of the trusty, and taketh away the understanding of the aged.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ammanettida asatakka co77u oottees; cimatuppekka akeekaa wotti ekkees.

English Sentences: He poureth contempt upon princes, and weakeneth the strength of the mighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Halaqata kaushshees; deriyaa kaalettiyaageetu wolqqaakka wurssees.

English Sentences: He discovereth deep things out of darkness, and bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xuman de7iya xuura yohota qonccissees; sakkana xuma sohuwaakka poo7o kessees.

English Sentences: He increaseth the nations, and destroyeth them: he enlargeth the nations, and straiteneth them again.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai kawotettata gitayees; gitayidi qassi xoonees. Kawotettaakka aassees; aassidi qassi xaissees.

English Sentences: He taketh away the heart of the chief of the people of the earth, and causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7aa asaa halaqata akeekaa diggidi, ogee bainna bazzuwan toilattanaadan oottees.

English Sentences: They grope in the dark without light, and he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Poo7oi bainna xuman eti tattaafoosona; mattottida asatudan eti ganddigaaroosona.

English Sentences: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hagaa ubbaa ta aifee be7iis; ta haittaikka siyidi akeekiis.

English Sentences: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte eriyoogaa taanikka erais; taani intteppe laafikke.

English Sentences: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin taani Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaassi haasayanau koyais; inttenaara gidenna. Taani ta mootuwaa aara mootettanau amottais.

English Sentences: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte erenna asa gidiyoogee erettennaadan, wordduwan kammeeta; intte ubbaikka pattenna aakimeta.

English Sentences: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ubbai co77u giidaa giderkketiishsha! Yaatiyaakko, inttena asai aadhdhida eranchcha gaana shin!

English Sentences: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha77i ta mootuwaa siyite; ta doonaappe kiyiya palamaa ezggite.

English Sentences: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte Xoossaa doona gididi, wordduwaa haasayeetiiyye? A gishshaa eqqidi, cimobaa haasayeetiiyye?

English Sentences: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte a maaddiyoobi de7ii? Woikko ayyo xabaqa gididi mootetteetii?

English Sentences: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?
Wolaitta Sentences: I inttena pilggi xeelliyaakko, intteppe lo77obaa demmanee? Intte asaa cimmiyoogaadan, a cimmanau danddayuuteetiiyye?

English Sentences: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte geeman asaa som77uwaa xeellidi maaddikko, Xoossai tumu inttena seerana.

English Sentences: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?
Wolaitta Sentences: A bonchchoi inttena daganttennee? A anggai inttena yashshennee?

English Sentences: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte odiyo leemisoti bidintta mala pattennaageeta; intte shiishshiyo palamai urqqaappe merettida gonddalliyaa mala.

English Sentences: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ane co77u giite! Taani haasayana; hagaappe guyyiyan, ba hanaa hano.

English Sentences: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani tana gakkiyaabaa, haiquwaa gidiyaakkokka, ekkanau giiga uttaas.

English Sentences: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7ite, Xoossai tana woriyaabaa gidikkonne, taani a danddayan naagana. Gidikkonne, taani ta mootuwaa a sintti shiishshana.

English Sentences: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nagaranchcha asi a sintti shiiqanau danddayenna; hagee taani shiiqanau xaliyoogee, ooni erii, ta atettaassi gaaso gidanau danddayees.

English Sentences: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta haasayaa akeekidi siyite; taani odiyoogee intte haittan gelo.

English Sentences: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7ite, taani ta mootuwaa giigissaas; shatimmanaagaakka erais.

English Sentences: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abeet Xoossau, neeni tana mootanau yai? Neeni tana mooranchcha kessikko, taani co77u gaada haiqqana.

English Sentences: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni taayyo ha naa77ubata ootta; oottikko taani neeppe geemmikke.

English Sentences: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana qaxxayiyoogaa agga; tana daganttoppa.

English Sentences: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, tana xeesa; xeesin taani koyana. Woikko taani haasayin, taayyo zaarada haasaya.

English Sentences: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bau, taani moorido mooroinne nagarai aappunee? Ta balaanne ta nagaraa ane tana bessa.

English Sentences: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni aibissi ne som77uwaa taappe genttai? Qassi tana aibissi ne morkkedan qoodai?

English Sentences: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana, carkkoi efiyo boncco malaa, yashissuutee? Woikko melida suulla malaa yedettuutee?

English Sentences: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ta bolli xaafido mootoi camo; harai attin, taani yelagatettan de7aidda oottido mooruwaanne ashshabaakka.

English Sentences: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ta tohuwaa toho biratan qachchadasa; ta tanggiyo tanggo ubbaa wochchaasa; ta tohuwaa kottiyaa pilgga xeellaasa.

English Sentences: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani musidabaadaaninne bil77ai miido afaladan musais.

English Sentences: Man that is born of a woman is of few days, and full of trouble.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Maccaasappe yelettida asa baree qantta; hegaa keesaikka metuwan kumi uttiis.

English Sentences: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: he fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ciishshaadan ciyyidi, sohuwaarakka qoqqofetti aggees; qassi gam77ennan kuwaadan eesuwan aadhdhiichchees.

English Sentences: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such an one, and bringest me into judgment with thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin neeni, Xoossai, hegaa mala asakka xeelluutee? Qassi a pirddanau ne sintti shiishshuutee?

English Sentences: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tunabaappe geeshshabaa kessanau danddayiyai oonee? Ooninne baawa.

English Sentences: Seeing his days are determined, the number of his months are with thee, thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi de7ana laittati zawati uttidosona; i de7ana aginaakka neeni qooda wottadasa; neeni wottido zawaappe aadhdhiyaabi baawa.

English Sentences: Turn from him, that he may rest, till he shall accomplish, as an hireling, his day.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, keraa oottiya asi ba oosuwaa polidi shemppiyoogaadan, asi ba daafura laittaa polidi shemppanaadan, a aggaaga.

English Sentences: For there is hope of a tree, if it be cut down, that it will sprout again, and that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Mittaassikka hidootai de7ees; mittai qanxxikko aacees; aacaikka hegaadan haniiddi, de7i bayees.

English Sentences: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, and the stock thereof die in the ground;
Wolaitta Sentences: He mittaa xaphoi biitta garssan ceeggikkokka, a durumaikka biittan musikkokka,

English Sentences: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, and bring forth boughs like a plant.
Wolaitta Sentences: haattaa peenuwaa demmidi aacees; puutiyaadan ooratta licuwaa kessees.

English Sentences: But man dieth, and wasteth away: yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin asi haiqqin, a wolqqai wurees; a shemppoi kiyaappe hini baggan, i awan de7ii?

English Sentences: As the waters fail from the sea, and the flood decayeth and drieth up:
Wolaitta Sentences: Abbaappe haattai meliyoogaadan, qassi shaafaa haattaikka to77iyoogaadan,

English Sentences: So man lieth down, and riseth not: till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, nor be raised out of their sleep.
Wolaitta Sentences: hegaadan asaikka haiqqees; he sohuwaappe denddenna. Saloti aadhdhana gakkanaashinkka asi beegottenna; ba xiskkuwaappekka denddenna.

English Sentences: O that thou wouldest hide me in the grave, that thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, that thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abeet Xoossau, neeni tana duufo giddon genttada, ne hanqqoi aadhdhana gakkanaashin qottidabaa gidarkkiishsha! Neeni taayyo keeruwaa immada, he gallassi tana hassayidabaa gidarkkiishsha!

English Sentences: If a man die, shall he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait, till my change come.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi asi haiqqikko, simmidi paxanee? Ta laamee yaana gakkanaashin, ha tugga wodiyaa ubbaa danddayan naagana.

English Sentences: Thou shalt call, and I will answer thee: thou wilt have a desire to the work of thine hands.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni medhdhido tanakka be7anau neeni laamotiyo wode, neeni tana xeesana; xeesin taani neeyyo koyana.

English Sentences: For now thou numberest my steps: dost thou not watch over my sin?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, neeni tumuppe ta tangguwaa wochchana; shin ta nagaraa ta bolli qoodakka.

English Sentences: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, and thou sewest up mine iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta mooroi qarcciitaa giddon yiicetti uttiis; ta nagaraakka neeni kammadasa.

English Sentences: And surely the mountain falling cometh to nought, and the rock is removed out of his place.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Deree kunddiyoonne meqerettiyoogaadan, zaallaikka xoqolettiyoogaadan,

English Sentences: The waters wear the stones: thou washest away the things which grow out of the dust of the earth; and thou destroyest the hope of man.
Wolaitta Sentences: haattaikka shuchchaa bookkiyoogaadaaninne di7oikka biittaa meeccidi efiyoogaadan, hegaadan neenikka asaa hidootaa xaissaasa.

English Sentences: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth: thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni a merinau xoonaasa; yaatobare i bi aggees. A meraanne laammada, ne sinttappe yeddaasa.

English Sentences: His sons come to honour, and he knoweth it not; and they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.
Wolaitta Sentences: A naati bonchchettikko, hegaa i erenna; eti tooshettikkokka be7enna.

English Sentences: But his flesh upon him shall have pain, and his soul within him shall mourn.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin a bollaa seelai a xalaalau siyettees; i ba xalaalau yeekkees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Temaana biittaappe yiida Elifaazi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: Should a wise man utter vain knowledge, and fill his belly with the east wind?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Aadhdhida eranchcha asi carkkodan ohettennabaa haasayii? Woikko arshsho bagga carkkuwaa ba uluwaa coo kunttii?

English Sentences: Should he reason with unprofitable talk? or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
Wolaitta Sentences: Pattenna woikko maaddenna mootuwaa mootettii?

English Sentences: Yea, thou castest off fear, and restrainest prayer before God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gidikko, neeni Xoossaassi yayyiyoogaa guuttadasa; haratikka Xoossaassi goinnennaadan diggaasa.

English Sentences: For thy mouth uttereth thine iniquity, and thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne iitatettai ne haasayan erettees; ne cincca haasayai nena genttees.

English Sentences: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I: yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne bolli pirddiyai ne doonaappe attin, tana gidikke; ne inxxarssai ne bolli markkattees.

English Sentences: Art thou the first man that was born? or wast thou made before the hills?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Koiro yelettida asi nenee? Woikko neeni dereti merettanaappe kase yelettadii?

English Sentences: Hast thou heard the secret of God? and dost thou restrain wisdom to thyself?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni Xoossaa xuura yaa7aa tumu siyadii? Woikko aadhdhida eratettaa ne xalaalai eriyaabaa neeyyo milatii?

English Sentences: What knowest thou, that we know not? what understandest thou, which is not in us?
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni erennabaa neeni eriyoobi aibee? Nuuyyo gelennan aggidi, neeyyo gelidabai aibee?

English Sentences: With us are both the grayheaded and very aged men, much elder than thy father.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aawaappe bairatiya asati, cimidi puulummida asati nu giddon de7oosona.

English Sentences: Are the consolations of God small with thee? is there any secret thing with thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai neeyyo immido minttettoinne nuuni neeyyo ashkketettan haasayido qaalai guutteeyye?

English Sentences: Why doth thine heart carry thee away? and what do thy eyes wink at,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne wozanai nena aissi wora efii? Ne aifeekka aissi xeelaa dereqqii?

English Sentences: That thou turnest thy spirit against God, and lettest such words go out of thy mouth?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatada neeni Xoossaa bolli hanqqettadasa; hegaa mala qaalaakka ne doonaappe kessadasa.

English Sentences: What is man, that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
