Wolaitta Sentences: Asi Xoossaa sinttan geeshsha gidanau danddayii? Woikko maccaasappe yelettida asi xillo gidanau danddayii?

English Sentences: Behold, he putteth no trust in his saints; yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7a, Xoossai ba kiitanchchatunkka ammanettenna; harai atto salotikka a sinttan geeshsha gidokkona.

English Sentences: How much more abominable and filthy is man, which drinketh iniquity like water?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha sheneyiyaanne tunida asi, nagaraakka haattaadan ganiya asi ubba iitaa darennee!

English Sentences: I will shew thee, hear me; and that which I have seen I will declare;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, ane siya! Taani neeyyo yootana; taani be7idobaa ubbaa neeyyo odana.

English Sentences: Which wise men have told from their fathers, and have not hid it:
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eranchcha asati bantta maizza aawatuppe demmido eratettaa genttennan tana tamaarissidosona.

English Sentences: Unto whom alone the earth was given, and no stranger passed among them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha biittai eta xalaalaassi imettiis; hara biittaa asaa timirttee eta giddon walahettibeenna.

English Sentences: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, and the number of years is hidden to the oppressor.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asa huqqunnidi de7iya iita asi, ba de7o laitta ubban tuggi appe shaahettenna.

English Sentences: A dreadful sound is in his ears: in prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaton daganttiya cenggurssai a haittan siyettees; i saro de7ais giishin, panggati a bolli yaana.

English Sentences: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, and he is waited for of the sword.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xumaappe kessi ekkanaagaa i ammanenna; i bisuwau qaadettiis.

English Sentences: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? he knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ahai ankkuwau quma gidana; baayyo xuma gallassai matattidoogaa i erees.

English Sentences: Trouble and anguish shall make him afraid; they shall prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Metoinne tuggai olau kiyida kawuwaadan a daganttana.

English Sentences: For he stretcheth out his hand against God, and strengtheneth himself against the Almighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, i ba kushiyaa Xoossaa bolli denttiis; Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa bollikka xaliis.

English Sentences: He runneth upon him, even on his neck, upon the thick bosses of his bucklers:
Wolaitta Sentences: Burzzuzzai burzzuzzai kiyi uttido ordde gonddalliyaa oiqqidi, Xoossaa bolli makkaliis.

English Sentences: Because he covereth his face with his fatness, and maketh collops of fat on his flanks.
Wolaitta Sentences: "A som77oi modhdhido gishshau, a xeessaikka boborccido gishshau,

English Sentences: And he dwelleth in desolate cities, and in houses which no man inhabiteth, which are ready to become heaps.
Wolaitta Sentences: i laattidi de7iyo katamatikka olan laalettido gishshaunne i de7iyo keettatikka ooninne de7enna ona gidido gishshau,

English Sentences: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, neither shall he prolong the perfection thereof upon the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: i ba duretettan daro gam77enna; a aqoikka aara takkenna.

English Sentences: He shall not depart out of darkness; the flame shall dry up his branches, and by the breath of his mouth shall he go away.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xumaappe i kessi ekkenna; a tasheta lacoi melissana; a ciishshaakka carkkoi pitti xaissana.

English Sentences: Let not him that is deceived trust in vanity: for vanity shall be his recompence.
Wolaitta Sentences: Barkka bana cimmiiddi, hadaban ammanettoppo. Ammanettikko, i ekkanabaikka hadabaa.

English Sentences: It shall be accomplished before his time, and his branch shall not be green.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wodee gakkennan shulliyaanne meli simmidi, naa77antto aacanau danddayenna mittaa mala i gidana.

English Sentences: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, and shall cast off his flower as the olive.
Wolaitta Sentences: Teerennan wurccuwaara qoqqofettiya woiniyaa malanne ciishshai qoqqofettiyo wogaraa mala i gidana.

English Sentences: For the congregation of hypocrites shall be desolate, and fire shall consume the tabernacles of bribery.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaassi yayyenna asatussi zaree xayana; mattaayiyan keexettida keettaakka tamai maana.

English Sentences: They conceive mischief, and bring forth vanity, and their belly prepareth deceit.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti metuwaa shahaaridi, iitabaa yeloosona; eta uluwankka cimoi kumi uttiis" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Job answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Iyyoobi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: I have heard many such things: miserable comforters are ye all.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani hagaa mala haasayaa daruwaa siyaas; intte minttettoos giiddi, tana metiyaageeta.

English Sentences: Shall vain words have an end? or what emboldeneth thee that thou answerest?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha go77i bainna intte haasayaayyo wurssetti baawee? Tanaara inttena hagaa keenaa palamissiya gaasoi aibee?

English Sentences: I also could speak as ye do: if your soul were in my soul's stead, I could heap up words against you, and shake mine head at you.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ta sohuwan de7in, taani intte sohuwan de7idabaa gidiyaakko, taanikka ta huuphiyaa qaattaidda, ha77i intte giyoobaa ubbaa intte bolli loittada haasayana shin!

English Sentences: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, and the moving of my lips should asswage your grief.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, ta zoriyan taani inttena minttana shin! Ta doonaappe kiyiya haasayaikka inttena minttettana shin!

English Sentences: Though I speak, my grief is not asswaged: and though I forbear, what am I eased?
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin taani haasayiyaakkokka, ta sahoi decenna; taani co77u gaada danddayiyaakkokka, taappe kichchenna.

English Sentences: But now he hath made me weary: thou hast made desolate all my company.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abeet Xoossau, neeni tana hitti oottadasa; ta keettaa asaa ubbaakka xaissadasa.

English Sentences: And thou hast filled me with wrinkles, which is a witness against me: and my leanness rising up in me beareth witness to my face.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ta gogaa melissadasanne gunddissadasa; ta bollaakka gilqqissadasa. Hegaa gishshau, asai tana be7idi, Hagee i nagaranchcha gidiyoogau markka yaagees.

English Sentences: He teareth me in his wrath, who hateth me: he gnasheth upon me with his teeth; mine enemy sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ba hanqquwan tana duuteretti yeggiis; ba achchaakka ta bolli garcciis; i ta morkkee tana dereqqees.

English Sentences: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; they have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully; they have gathered themselves together against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asati ta yuushuwan shiiqidosona; shiiqidi ta bolli qilliicciiddi, ta qinxxalliyaa baqqidosona.

English Sentences: God hath delivered me to the ungodly, and turned me over into the hands of the wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai nagaraa oottiya asatuyyo tana aattidi immiis; iitatu kushiyankka i tana oliis.

English Sentences: I was at ease, but he hath broken me asunder: he hath also taken me by my neck, and shaken me to pieces, and set me up for his mark.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani kase woppu gaada de7aas; shin Xoossai tana kinchcherettiis; ta mirggaaciyaa oiqqidi, i tana mentterettiis. Qassi i tana zambbi kaa7anau baazzan wottiis;

English Sentences: His archers compass me round about, he cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; he poureth out my gall upon the ground.
Wolaitta Sentences: a wonddafiyaa zubbeti tana yaara haara muddidosona. Qareti bainnan i ta kilahuwaa caddidi, ta ciyyiyaa ta tiriyaappe sa7an gussees.

English Sentences: He breaketh me with breach upon breach, he runneth upon me like a giant.
Wolaitta Sentences: Olanau woxxiya olanchchaadan, i tana zaari zaaridi masunxxissees.

English Sentences: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, and defiled my horn in the dust.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani kayottada, waaruwaa maayaas; ta wolqqaikka baanan olettiis.

English Sentences: My face is foul with weeping, and on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani yeekkiyo yeehuwaa daruwan ta som77oi puuriis; ta aifeekka zo77iis.

English Sentences: Not for any injustice in mine hands: also my prayer is pure.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha ubbankka taani mooridobi baawa; ta woosaikka geeshsha.

English Sentences: O earth, cover not thou my blood, and let my cry have no place.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Biittau, biittau, ta suuttaa kammoppa; taani waassanaagaa diggoppa.

English Sentences: Also now, behold, my witness is in heaven, and my record is on high.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha77ikka ta markkai saluwaana; taayyo xabaqatiyaagee bolla xoqqaana.

English Sentences: My friends scorn me: but mine eye poureth out tears unto God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta laggeti tana karidi xeelloosona; ta aifee Xoossaa sinttan afuttaa tigees.

English Sentences: O that one might plead for a man with God, as a man pleadeth for his neighbour!
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaa asaara walassidi sigettiya asi de7iyoogaadan, tana Xoossaara sigettiya asi de7idaa gideerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: When a few years are come, then I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, aramida laittati aadhdhidoogaappe guyyiyan, taani simmennasaa baana.

English Sentences: My breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves are ready for me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta shemppiyaa kiyausu; ta laittai qaammiis; taayyo duufoi giigi uttiis.

English Sentences: Are there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana qilliicciyaageeti tumuppe ta yuushuwan de7oosona; eti taayyo yiillotiyo yiilluwaa ubbaton taani be7ais.

English Sentences: Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; who is he that will strike hands with me?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abeet Xoossau, neeppe hari tana maaddiyaabi bainna gishshau, neeni ne huuphiyan taayyo waase gida.

English Sentences: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etau gelennaadan, neeni ta laggetu wozanaa dammettadasa. Hegaa gishshau, neeni etau xoonuwaa immoppa.

English Sentences: He that speaketh flattery to his friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.
Wolaitta Sentences: Miishshaa demmana giidi, ba laggeta aatti immiya asaa nagarai a naata kaa7ana.

English Sentences: He hath made me also a byword of the people; and aforetime I was as a tabret.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai tana asa ubbau qilliicciyoobaa kessiis; asi som77uwan cuchchiyo asa taani gidaas.

English Sentences: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members are as a shadow.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani daro kayyottido gishshau, ta aifeekka galjjiis; ta kushetinne ta tohoti laafidi, xinqqo keesa kiyidosona.

English Sentences: Upright men shall be astonied at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.
Wolaitta Sentences: Keha asati tana be7idi dagammidosona; suuretikka Xoossaa kaddiyaageetu bolli yiillotidosona.

English Sentences: The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gidikkonne, xilloti bantta ogiyaappe yaakka haakka simmokkona; suureti wolqqaa gujji gujji boosona.

English Sentences: But as for you all, do ye return, and come now: for I cannot find one wise man among you.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha77i ubbaikka ane taakko haa yiite! Yiyaakkokka, taani intte giddon issi aadhdhida eranchcha asakka demmikke.

English Sentences: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, even the thoughts of my heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta de7o laittai wuriis; ta halchchido halchchoikka ta wozanaa amoikka coo attiis.

English Sentences: They change the night into day: the light is short because of darkness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta laggeti qammaa gallassa goosona; xumi uttidaashin, Poo7ana hanees yaagoosona.

English Sentences: If I wait, the grave is mine house: I have made my bed in the darkness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ufaissan naagiyo ta keettai duufuwaa; ta hiixaakka yan xuman hiixxana.

English Sentences: I have said to corruption, Thou art my father: to the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister.
Wolaitta Sentences: Duufuwaa taani, Neeni ta aawaa yaagana; guxuniyaakka, Neeni ta aayyiyo woikko Ta michchiyo yaagana.

English Sentences: And where is now my hope? as for my hope, who shall see it?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, ta hidootai awaanee? Ooni a be7idee?

English Sentences: They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when our rest together is in the dust.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta hidootai tanaara duufuwaa banddee? Nuuni naa77ai issippe biittan duge wodhdhaneeshsha?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, SHuuha biittaappe yiida Bilddaadi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: How long will it be ere ye make an end of words? mark, and afterwards we will speak.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, neeni ha haasayaa aude wurssuutee? Ane akeeka. Yaatobare nuuni haasayana.

English Sentences: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, and reputed vile in your sight?
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuna aissi miizza kessai? Aissi nuna damma kessai?

English Sentences: He teareth himself in his anger: shall the earth be forsaken for thee? and shall the rock be removed out of his place?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ne hanqquwan nena qohaasa. Ne hanqquwan biittai baisa gidanee? Woikko zaallati bantta sohuwaappe xoqolettanee?

English Sentences: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, and the spark of his fire shall not shine.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Nagaranchchatu de7oi xomppee to7iyoogaadan to7anaagee geeshsha; i naa77antto mulekka eexxenna.

English Sentences: The light shall be dark in his tabernacle, and his candle shall be put out with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: I xomppee bainna keetta mala; kase a matan de7iya xomppeekka to7ees.

English Sentences: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, and his own counsel shall cast him down.
Wolaitta Sentences: I tanggiyo tanggoikka qaammees; i haraata zoriyo zoree a onggees.

English Sentences: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, and he walketh upon a snare.
Wolaitta Sentences: "A hemetai a efiidi, piriyan gelissees; diizzaa giddon i hemettees.

English Sentences: The gin shall take him by the heel, and the robber shall prevail against him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Piree a ginddiyaa oiqqees; oiqqidi a qaatuwaa diggees.

English Sentences: The snare is laid for him in the ground, and a trap for him in the way.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ayyo yurddo wodoroi geeman sa7an hiixetti uttees; i hemettiyo ogiyankka gitee wodhdhi uttees.

English Sentences: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, and shall drive him to his feet.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Dagamai a dooddees; dagamai a guyyeera ginddiyaa matidi yedettees.

English Sentences: His strength shall be hungerbitten, and destruction shall be ready at his side.
Wolaitta Sentences: A wolqqai namisan daafuriis; bashshai a lanqqen naagees.

English Sentences: It shall devour the strength of his skin: even the firstborn of death shall devour his strength.
Wolaitta Sentences: Woriya harggee a bollan ubban woraajjees; a kushiyaanne a tohuwaa duushissees.

English Sentences: His confidence shall be rooted out of his tabernacle, and it shall bring him to the king of terrors.
Wolaitta Sentences: I hirggi bainnan de7iyo ba keettaappe yedetettees; eti Haiquwaa giyo kawuwaakko, a efoosona.

English Sentences: It shall dwell in his tabernacle, because it is none of his: brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
Wolaitta Sentences: Harggiyaa gooddanau dinniyaa laaloogaappe guyyiyan, ooninne a keettan de7ana.

English Sentences: His roots shall be dried up beneath, and above shall his branch be cut off.
Wolaitta Sentences: I xaphoi garssaara meliyoonne tashetikka bollaara qoqqofettiyo mittaa mala gidees.

English Sentences: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, and he shall have no name in the street.
Wolaitta Sentences: A woree biittaappe xayees; a sunttaikka sa7an hassayettennan attees.

English Sentences: He shall be driven from light into darkness, and chased out of the world.
Wolaitta Sentences: I poo7uwaappe xumau yedetettana; asai de7iyo biittaappekka i xayana.

English Sentences: He shall neither have son nor nephew among his people, nor any remaining in his dwellings.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ayyo na7i woikko zaree xayana; i de7ido sohuwan issi asinne paxa attenna.

English Sentences: They that come after him shall be astonied at his day, as they that went before were affrighted.
Wolaitta Sentences: Arggo bagga asai a gakkidaban dagammees; arshsho bagga asaikka yashshau kokkorees.

English Sentences: Surely such are the dwellings of the wicked, and this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Audekka iita asatu wurssettai hegaa mala; Xoossaa erennaageetu qaadaikka hegaa mala" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Job answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Iyyoobi zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: How long will ye vex my soul, and break me in pieces with words?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte tana aude gakkanaassi mudduuteetii? Aude gakkanaassi intte qaalan tana gaaccuuteetii?

English Sentences: These ten times have ye reproached me: ye are not ashamed that ye make yourselves strange to me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte tana tammutoo cayideta; tana kaushshiiddikka yeellatekketa.

English Sentences: And be it indeed that I have erred, mine error remaineth with myself.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani tumu balidabaa gidiyaakkokka, ta balai tana oichchana.

English Sentences: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, and plead against me my reproach:
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte taappe kehiyoobaa intteyyo milatin, Hagee metoi ubbai a gakkidoogee, i moorido gishshaassa yaagidi, ta bolli pirddeeta.

English Sentences: Know now that God hath overthrown me, and hath compassed me with his net.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha metuwaa ubbaa ta bolli gattidaageenne gitiyan tana gelissidaagee Xoossaa gidiyoogaa erite.

English Sentences: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry aloud, but there is no judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani, Naaqettaas yaagada waassin, taayyo alliyaabi baawa; qaalaa xoqqu oottada, suure pirddaassi waassinkka, siyiyaabi baawa.

English Sentences: He hath fenced up my way that I cannot pass, and he hath set darkness in my paths.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani kanttennaadan Xoossai ta ogiyaa diriis; ta hemettiyoosaakka xuman gooziis.

English Sentences: He hath stripped me of my glory, and taken the crown from my head.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta duretettaa taappe qaariis; ta bonchchuwaakka taappe diggiis.

English Sentences: He hath destroyed me on every side, and I am gone: and mine hope hath he removed like a tree.
Wolaitta Sentences: I tana mentteretti yeggiis; ta hidootaakka xaphuwaara xoqolettida mittaa mala oottiis.

English Sentences: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, and he counteth me unto him as one of his enemies.
Wolaitta Sentences: A hanqqoi ta bolli eexxi kiyiis; i tana ba morkkedan qoodees.

English Sentences: His troops come together, and raise up their way against me, and encamp round about my tabernacle.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta bolli woraajjanau i ba olanchchata kiittees; eti tana olanau ogiyaa kessoosona; ta dunkkaaniyaa yuushuwaakka dooddoosona.

English Sentences: He hath put my brethren far from me, and mine acquaintance are verily estranged from me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai ta ishata taappe haassiis; tana eriyaageeti muleera taayyo allaga gididosona.

English Sentences: My kinsfolk have failed, and my familiar friends have forgotten me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta dabboti taappe shaahettidosona; ta laggetikka tana dogidosona.

English Sentences: They that dwell in mine house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta son de7iya imattati tana dogidosona; ta macca ashkkaratikka tana imattadaaninne betedan xeelloosona.

English Sentences: I called my servant, and he gave me no answer; I intreated him with my mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ta ashkkaraa xeegin, taayyo koyenna; taani woossinkka, taayyo eenenna.

English Sentences: My breath is strange to my wife, though I intreated for the children's sake of mine own body.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta maccaasiyaa ta doonaa peenuwaa ixxaasu; ta ishanttikka tana shenetoosona.

English Sentences: Yea, young children despised me; I arose, and they spake against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Harai attin, guutta naatikka tana karoosona; taani eqqiyo wode, ta bolli qilliiccoosona.

English Sentences: All my inward friends abhorred me: and they whom I loved are turned against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta mata laggeti ubbai tana shenetoosona; taani siiqidoogeetikka taayyo zokkuwaa zaaridosona.

English Sentences: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, and I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta meqettai ta gogaara ohettiis; haiquwaappe qiisasan taani attaas.

English Sentences: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; for the hand of God hath touched me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Inttenoo ta laggetoo, Xoossaa kushee tana dechchido gishshau, taayyo qarettite.

English Sentences: Why do ye persecute me as God, and are not satisfied with my flesh?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai tana yedettiyoogaadan, intte tana aissi yedetteetii? Hanno gakkanaassi intte tana tuggayidoogee gidennee?

English Sentences: Oh that my words were now written! oh that they were printed in a book!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hanno gakkanaashin taani haasayido qaalai, wai hassayettidaa gideerenneeshsha! Maxaafankka wai xaafettidaa gideerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: That they were graven with an iron pen and lead in the rock for ever!
Wolaitta Sentences: Daro gam77ana mala, birata maarisan zaallaa bollan woocettidi xaafetteerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: For I know that my redeemer liveth, and that he shall stand at the latter day upon the earth:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Tana Wozidaagee paxa de7iyoogaanne wurssettan biittaa bollan i eqqanaagaa taani erais.

English Sentences: And though after my skin worms destroy this body, yet in my flesh shall I see God:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta gogai meetetti wurikkonne, taani ta ashuwaappe shaahettada, Xoossaa be7anaagaa erais.

English Sentences: Whom I shall see for myself, and mine eyes shall behold, and not another; though my reins be consumed within me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hara uraa gidennan, taani ta huuphen, ta aifiyan a be7ana. Hegaa gishshau, ta wozanai aiba laamotii!

English Sentences: But ye should say, Why persecute we him, seeing the root of the matter is found in me?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte, Metuwaayyo unkkoi a gidido gishshau, ane haayite! A yedettoos! giikko,

English Sentences: Be ye afraid of the sword: for wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, that ye may know there is a judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: bisuwaayyo yayyite! Xoossaa hanqqoi bisuwaara yaana; pirddai de7iyoogaakka erite" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Naa7ima biittaappe yiida Xoofaari hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for this I make haste.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ne haasayai tana lanccissido gishshau, taani ainne takkennan ne haasayaayyo zaaruwaa immana.

English Sentences: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne cashsha haasayaa taani siyais; siyin ayyo bessiya zaaruwaa tana imma imma gees.

English Sentences: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asa biittaa bolli wottido wodiyaappe doommidi, beniisappekka nagaranchcha asatu ceeqoi qantta wodiyaassa gidiyoogaa,

English Sentences: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa erenna asatu ufaissaikka liphida aifee xeellanaashiina gidiyoogaa neeni eraasa.

English Sentences: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi shaaraa gakkanaashin aduqqikkokka,

English Sentences: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they which have seen him shall say, Where is he?
Wolaitta Sentences: i buhiyaadan pitetti xayana. A eriya ubbai, I awan de7ii? yaagana.

English Sentences: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aimuwaadan i paalli xayana; simmidikka beettenna; qammaa ajjuutaadan i xayi bayana.

English Sentences: The eye also which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.
Wolaitta Sentences: A be7ida aifeti naa77anttidi, a be7okkona; i ba de7iyoosaappekka tippi giidi xayana.

English Sentences: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita aawai bonqqi ekkido miishshaa a naati bantta kushiyan guyye zaarana.

English Sentences: His bones are full of the sin of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.
Wolaitta Sentences: Payyanne mino gidiya a bollai guutta wodiyaappe guyyiyan, biitta kiyana.

English Sentences: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iita asa doonan iitatettai qumadan laqilaqikkokka, i ba inxxarssaappe garssa baggaara genttikkokka,

English Sentences: Though he spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth:
Wolaitta Sentences: wurennaadan ba doonan coommiiddi, wotti bayikkokka,

English Sentences: Yet his meat in his bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within him.
Wolaitta Sentences: a ulo giddon a qumai laamettana; laamettidi woriya shooshshaa yiishshaa mala au gidana.

English Sentences: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi ba mittido duretettaa haa cuchchana; a uluwaappe Xoossai cooshshidi kessana.

English Sentences: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper's tongue shall slay him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asi mittiyoobai au yiishsha gidana; shooshshaa yiishshaa mala gididi, a worana.

English Sentences: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eessainne maattai haattaadan goggishin, i be7ennan haiqqana.

English Sentences: That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down: according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice therein.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba daafurido daafuraa cawaa meennan, haraassi sheedhdhana; zal77idi worissido ba woriyankka ufaittenna.

English Sentences: Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor; because he hath violently taken away an house which he builded not;
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, hiyyeesata i un77ettiis; eta shenehoo giis; hara asi keexxido keettaakka bau ekkiis.

English Sentences: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.
Wolaitta Sentences: "A yiiqiyau zawi baawa; ba dosiyoobaa xarzzanau danddayenna;

English Sentences: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.
Wolaitta Sentences: i miidoogaappe guyyiyan, aibinne attenna. Hegaa gishshau, a duretettai gam77enna.

English Sentences: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.
Wolaitta Sentences: I daro aquwaa demmiyo wode, metoi akeekennan a bolli gakki wodhdhana.

English Sentences: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.
Wolaitta Sentences: I miidi kallishin, Xoossai a qaxxayanau ba suulliya hanqquwaa a bolli gussana.

English Sentences: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of steel shall strike him through.
Wolaitta Sentences: Birata bisuwaappe i baqatana; shin nahaasiyaa zubbee a caddana.

English Sentences: It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors are upon him.
Wolaitta Sentences: He zubbee ayyo zokkuwaara kantti kiyana; he phooliyaa xeerai a tiriyaa kanttidi, ciyyiyaa gussana. Hegaa gishshau, dagamai a wozanaa shabbirana.

English Sentences: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.
Wolaitta Sentences: "I shiishshido aqo ubbai xayana; asi eettibeenna tamai a maana; a keettan attida asai ubbaikka taman meetettana.

English Sentences: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Saloti ha bitaniyaa nagaraa qonccissana; biittaikka a bolli markkattana.

English Sentences: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai hanqqettidi ehiyo beetan a keettainne ayyo de7iyaabai ubbai shohettidi baana.

English Sentences: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai iita asatuyyo wottido qaadai hagaa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But Job answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Iyyoobi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: Hear diligently my speech, and let this be your consolations.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ane ta haasayaa akeekidi ezggite; ezggiyoogee intte tana minttettiyoogaa gido bayin.

English Sentences: Suffer me that I may speak; and after that I have spoken, mock on.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani issiton haasayanau taayyo kayaa immite. Taani haasaya simmin, qilliiccite!

English Sentences: As for me, is my complaint to man? and if it were so, why should not my spirit be troubled?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani mootettiyoi asaara gidenna. Yaatin, tau danddayai wurikko, hegee garamissiyaabee?

English Sentences: Mark me, and be astonished, and lay your hand upon your mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ane tana xeellite; xeellidi garamettite; intte kushiyankka intte doonaa oiqqite.

English Sentences: Even when I remember I am afraid, and trembling taketh hold on my flesh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana gakkidabaa taani qoppiyo wodekka, tana daganttees; ta bollaikka kokkorees.

English Sentences: Wherefore do the wicked live, become old, yea, are mighty in power?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iita asati aissi paxa de7iyoonaa? Eta baree aissi aduqqii? Eta wolqqaikka aissi dari dari bii?

English Sentences: Their seed is established in their sight with them, and their offspring before their eyes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etau naatinne naatu naati de7oosona; eti diccishin be7anau, gam77idi de7oosona.

English Sentences: Their houses are safe from fear, neither is the rod of God upon them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta soi hirggi bainnan saro de7ees; Xoossai eta ba gatiman shoci erenna.

English Sentences: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta korima boorati macca miizzaara gaittiyo wode, koxxennaadan oittoosona; macca miizzatikka aucayennan yeloosona.

English Sentences: They send forth their little ones like a flock, and their children dance.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bantta naata dorssaa wudiyaadan kessoosona; eta naatikka yan han duroosona.

English Sentences: They take the timbrel and harp, and rejoice at the sound of the organ.
Wolaitta Sentences: Karaabiyaa baqqiiddinne diittaa diixxiiddi, yettaa yexxoosona; pulaaliyaa punniiddikka ufaittoosona.

English Sentences: They spend their days in wealth, and in a moment go down to the grave.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta de7o laittaa ishaluwan polidi, bantta duufuwaakka saro boosona.

English Sentences: Therefore they say unto God, Depart from us; for we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaanidikka eti Xoossaa, Nuuppe haakka! Nuuni ne ogiyaa eranau koyokko!

English Sentences: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? and what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni ayyo oottanau Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai oonee? Nuuni a woossidi, go7ettanabi aibee? yaagoosona.

English Sentences: Lo, their good is not in their hand: the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta ishalo de7uwaa bantta minotettan demmida goosona; shin taani eta qofaa ekkikke.

English Sentences: How oft is the candle of the wicked put out! and how oft cometh their destruction upon them! God distributeth sorrows in his anger.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iita asatu de7uwaa xomppee to7i erii? Eta bolli bashshai wodhdhi erii? Xoossai ba hanqquwan eta qaxxayi erii?

English Sentences: They are as stubble before the wind, and as chaff that the storm carrieth away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Carkkuwaa sinttan eti suullaadan hanido wodee de7ii? Gotee pitti efiyo baanaadan eti hani eriyoonaa?

English Sentences: God layeth up his iniquity for his children: he rewardeth him, and he shall know it.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte, Xoossai aawatu mooruwan eta naata qaxxayees yaageeta. Ane Xoossai nagaranchchata eta huuphen qaxxayo! Yaatiyaakko eti bantta mooruwaa erana.

English Sentences: His eyes shall see his destruction, and he shall drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta qixaatiyaa banttau ekkona. Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa hanqquwaa xuu7aakka eti bantta huuphen uyona.

English Sentences: For what pleasure hath he in his house after him, when the number of his months is cut off in the midst?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eti haiqqiichchidoogaappe guyyiyan, eta naata aibi gakkikkonne koyokkona.

English Sentences: Shall any teach God knowledge? seeing he judgeth those that are high.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Bolla xoqqan de7iyaageeta pirddiya Xoossaa eraa tamaarissanau danddayiya asi de7ii?

English Sentences: One dieth in his full strength, being wholly at ease and quiet.
Wolaitta Sentences: Issi asi kumetta wolqqainne kumetta saroi de7ishin, ishaluwan de7iiddi haiqqees.

English Sentences: His breasts are full of milk, and his bones are moistened with marrow.
Wolaitta Sentences: A bollai orddidaashin, a meqettaa kolzzeekka shica de7ishin haiqqees.

English Sentences: And another dieth in the bitterness of his soul, and never eateth with pleasure.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin hara asi a shemppuwan azzanoi paccennan, ba de7on mulekka lo77obaa demmennan haiqqees.

English Sentences: They shall lie down alike in the dust, and the worms shall cover them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiqqidi eti naa77aikka issi mala biittan moogettoosona; eta naa77aakka guxuneti kammoosona.

English Sentences: Behold, I know your thoughts, and the devices which ye wrongfully imagine against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte tana naaqqanau qoppidi, intte wozanan halchchido halchchuwaa muliyaa taani loittada erais.

English Sentences: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? and where are the dwelling places of the wicked?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte, He iitaa oottiya, gita bitaniyaa keettai ha77i awaanee? yaageeta.

English Sentences: Have ye not asked them that go by the way? and do ye not know their tokens,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ogiyaara hemettiya asata oichchibeekketii? Eti odiyoogaa ammanekketii?

English Sentences: That the wicked is reserved to the day of destruction? they shall be brought forth to the day of wrath.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti, Iita asati bashshaa gallassi boshettennan attoosona; Xoossaa hanqqoi qoncciyo gallassikka eti kessi ekkana yaagoosona.

English Sentences: Who shall declare his way to his face? and who shall repay him what he hath done?
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asa a iitatettau oonee walassanai? I oottido iitabaukka a qaxxayanai oonee?

English Sentences: Yet shall he be brought to the grave, and shall remain in the tomb.
Wolaitta Sentences: I haiqqin, a ahaa duufuwaa efiyo wode, a duufoi bonchchuwan naagettana.

English Sentences: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, and every man shall draw after him, as there are innumerable before him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qoodi bainna asai a baliyan pe7ees; a duufuwaa biittaikka utulaadan au kauyyees.

English Sentences: How then comfort ye me in vain, seeing in your answers there remaineth falsehood?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, intte tana waati hada oduwan minttetteetii? Intte ta oishaassi zaarido zaaroi ubbai worddo!" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Temaana biittaappe yiida Elifaazi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: Can a man be profitable unto God, as he that is wise may be profitable unto himself?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asi Xoossaa go77anau danddayii? Harai atto aadhdhida eranchcha gidiyaakkokka, i bana go77anaappe attin, Xoossaa go77enna.

English Sentences: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni xillo gidikko, hegee Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa ufaissii? Ne ogee boree bainnaagaa gidikko, hegan i aiba wore demmii?

English Sentences: Will he reprove thee for fear of thee? will he enter with thee into judgment?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni ayyo yayyiyo gishshaassee, i nena seeriyoogeenne pirddiyoogee?

English Sentences: Is not thy wickedness great? and thine iniquities infinite?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne iitatettai daro gidennee? Ne nagarau zawi baawa.

English Sentences: For thou hast taken a pledge from thy brother for nought, and stripped the naked of their clothing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ne ishata gaasoi bainnan waasiyaa xeesissadasa; asaa maayuwaakka qaarada eta kallo ashshadasa.

English Sentences: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, and thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni saamettidaageeta haattaa ushshabaakka; namisettidaageetakka qumaa diggadasa.

English Sentences: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; and the honourable man dwelt in it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ne wolqqaaninne ne maatan zemppada, hara asaa biittaa neeyyo coo ekkadasa.

English Sentences: Thou hast sent widows away empty, and the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
Wolaitta Sentences: Am77eta mela kushe yeddadasa; aawi bainnaageetakka huqqunnadasa.

English Sentences: Therefore snares are round about thee, and sudden fear troubleth thee;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne yuushuwan gitee dooddi uttidoogee hegaassa; akeekennan yashshai nena kokkorssiyoogeekka hegaassa.

English Sentences: Or darkness, that thou canst not see; and abundance of waters cover thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni be7ennaadan, neeyyo xumiyoogee hegaassa; qassi kixa haattai nena muukkiyoogeekka hegaassa.

English Sentences: Is not God in the height of heaven? and behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai bolla xoqqa saluwan uttidi, xoqqan de7iya xoolintteta duge xeellees.

English Sentences: And thou sayest, How doth God know? can he judge through the dark cloud?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin neeni, Xoossai ai erii? I hegaa mala, sakkana xumaa giddoorakka pirddanau danddayii?

English Sentences: Thick clouds are a covering to him, that he seeth not; and he walketh in the circuit of heaven.
Wolaitta Sentences: Salo gufanttuwaa bolli i simerettiyo wode, i be7ennaadan, sikkida shaarai a goozees yaagaasa.

English Sentences: Hast thou marked the old way which wicked men have trodden?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Nagaranchchati hemettido beni ogiyan baanau qofaa qachchadii?

English Sentences: Which were cut down out of time, whose foundation was overflown with a flood:
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta wodee gakkennan de7ishin haiqqidosona; eta de7uwaa baasoikka di7uwan meecetti xayiis.

English Sentences: Which said unto God, Depart from us: and what can the Almighty do for them?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti Xoossaa, Nuuppe haakka! Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai nuuyyo ai oottanau danddayii? yaagidosona.

English Sentences: Yet he filled their houses with good things: but the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gidikkonne, eta keettan lo77obaa kunttidaagee Xoossaa. Hegaa gishshau, iita asatu qofai taayyo gelenna.

English Sentences: The righteous see it, and are glad: and the innocent laugh them to scorn.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iita asatu bolli gakkiyaabaa be7idi, xilloti ufaittoosona; suure asatikka hagaadan yaagidi, eta bolli qilliiccoosona;

English Sentences: Whereas our substance is not cut down, but the remnant of them the fire consumeth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tumaappe nu morkketi xayidosona; eta duretettaakka tamai miis yaagoosona.

English Sentences: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: thereby good shall come unto thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, ha77ikka Xoossaara giiga; aara saro de7a. Yaatikko, neeni anjjettana.

English Sentences: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, and lay up his words in thine heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: A doonaappe timirttiyaa ekka; a qaalatakka ne wozanan wotta.

English Sentences: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, thou shalt put away iniquity far from thy tabernacles.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nenatettaa ziqqissada, Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaakko, neeni simma; iita ooso ubbaa ne sooppe digga.

English Sentences: Then shalt thou lay up gold as dust, and the gold of Ophir as the stones of the brooks.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne worqqaa sa7an ola; ne muruta worqqaakka shaafaa shuchchan ola.

English Sentences: Yea, the Almighty shall be thy defence, and thou shalt have plenty of silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai neeyyo worqqanne doorettida bira gido.

English Sentences: For then shalt thou have thy delight in the Almighty, and shalt lift up thy face unto God.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaappe guyyiyan, neeni Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossan tumu ufaittana; ufaittada yeellatenna Xoossaakko pude xeellana.

English Sentences: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he shall hear thee, and thou shalt pay thy vows.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni Xoossaa woossana; woossin i siyana; qassi neeni ne shiiquwaa ayyo gattana.

English Sentences: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee: and the light shall shine upon thy ways.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni zorettada qachchidobai neeyyo polettana; ne hemettiyo ogiyankka poo7oi poo7ana.

English Sentences: When men are cast down, then thou shalt say, There is lifting up; and he shall save the humble person.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossai otorettiyaageeta kaushshees; shin banttana ziqqissiyaageeta ashshees.

English Sentences: He shall deliver the island of the innocent: and it is delivered by the pureness of thine hands.
Wolaitta Sentences: I suure asa wotti ekkees. Ne kushee naaquwaappe geeshsha gidikko, i nena ashshana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Job answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Iyyoobi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: Even to day is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ha77ikka Xoossaa bolli makkalaisinne zuuzummais; aissi giikko, taani oolinkka a kushee ta bolli deexxiyoogaa aggibeenna.

English Sentences: Oh that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!
Wolaitta Sentences: I de7iyoosaa taani erarkkinaashsha! I uttidosaakka gakkarkkinaashsha!

English Sentences: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatiyaakko, taani ta mootuwaa a sinttan biddana shin! Ta doonaakka palaman kunttana shin!

English Sentences: I would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ta mootuwaayyo zaariyoobi aibakkokka taani erana shin!

English Sentences: Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba gita wolqqan tanaara eqettaneeshsha? CHii, chii, i taani odiyoogaa siyanaappe attin, hegaa hanenna.

English Sentences: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta wozanai suure gidiyo gishshau, taani Xoossaara mootettanau danddayais; i ta daannai tana merinau shatinttana.

English Sentences: Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin aissee, taani arshsho biikko, i yan de7enna; qassi taani arggo biikkokka, a demmikke.

English Sentences: On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold him: he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him:
Wolaitta Sentences: I huuphessa bagga biittan oottiyo wode, taani a be7ikke; qassi tohossa bagga biitti simmiyo wodekka, taani a demmikke.

English Sentences: But he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin i ta tangguwaa ubbaa erees; i tana paaccikko, taani worqqaadan geeshsha gidiyoogaa i be7ana.

English Sentences: My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani i hemettido ogiyaa baqqa oiqqada hemettaas; a ogiyaappe wora simmabeikke.

English Sentences: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
Wolaitta Sentences: A doonaappe kiyiya azazuwaappe taani shaahettabeikke; a qaalaakka ta wozanan wottaas.

English Sentences: But he is in one mind, and who can turn him? and what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai laamettenna. Aara eqettana, woikko ba koyidobaa i oottennaadan a teqqana asi baawa.

English Sentences: For he performeth the thing that is appointed for me: and many such things are with him.
Wolaitta Sentences: I taayyo halchchidobaa polana; hegeetu mala, hara daro halchchotikka ayyo de7oosona.

English Sentences: Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, a sinttan eqqiyoogee keehippe tana yashshees; hegaa ubbabaa qoppada, taani kokkorais.

English Sentences: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta wozanai taahanaadan Xoossai oottiis; Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai tana daganttiis.

English Sentences: Because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither hath he covered the darkness from my face.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sakkana xumai ta som77uwaa goozikkokka, tana he xumai haasayaa diggibeenna.

English Sentences: Why, seeing times are not hidden from the Almighty, do they that know him not see his days?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai pirddiyo wodiyaa aissi keerennee? A eriyaageeti he wodiyaa aissi be7okkonaa?

English Sentences: Some remove the landmarks; they violently take away flocks, and feed thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asati bantta gadiyaa aassanau, zawan de7iya shuchchaa shoddoosona. Dorssaakka wuuqqi ehiidi, bantta dorssaa wudiyan gattidi heemmoosona.

English Sentences: They drive away the ass of the fatherless, they take the widow's ox for a pledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aawai bainna naatu hareta laaggidi, ekki boosona; am77ee booraakka acuwau oiqqidi, banttau ekkoosona.

English Sentences: They turn the needy out of the way: the poor of the earth hide themselves together.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesata ogiyaappe yedettoosona; biittan de7iya hiyyeesata ubbaa bantta sinttappe qosetissoosona.

English Sentences: Behold, as wild asses in the desert, go they forth to their work; rising betimes for a prey: the wilderness yieldeth food for them and for their children.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bazzon de7iya harddiidatudan, hiyyeesati bantta naatuyyo miyoobaa koyiiddi, bazzon daafuroosona.

English Sentences: They reap every one his corn in the field: and they gather the vintage of the wicked.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti dembban hara asau kattaa cakkoosona; iita asatu woiniyaa teera wurccuwaakka xunqqoosona.

English Sentences: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing, that they have no covering in the cold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti qammaa kallo aqoosona; meeguwaa wodekka bollan paliyoobi etau baawa.

English Sentences: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, and embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
Wolaitta Sentences: Deretun bukkiya iran eti murxxoosona; geliyoosaa xayidi, shuchchaa qoommoosona.

English Sentences: They pluck the fatherless from the breast, and take a pledge of the poor.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iita asati aawai bainna na7aa aayee xanttaa xammiyoosaappe dafi ekkoosona; hiyyeesatu guutta naatakka acuwaayyo oiqqoosona.

English Sentences: They cause him to go naked without clothing, and they take away the sheaf from the hungry;
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesati maayuwaa xayidi, kallo hemettoosona. Eti mirqqiyaa miyyiiddi namisettoosona.

English Sentences: Which make oil within their walls, and tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti zaitiyaa kessanau wogaraa teeraa burxxoosona; woine teeraakka gum77iiddi saamettoosona.

English Sentences: Men groan from out of the city, and the soul of the wounded crieth out: yet God layeth not folly to them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kataman kataman haiqqana haniya asati ooloosona; deshettida asatikka maaduwaa koyidi waassoosona; shin Xoossai eta metuwaa xeellenna.

English Sentences: They are of those that rebel against the light; they know not the ways thereof, nor abide in the paths thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Poo7uwaa ixxiya asati de7oosona; eti poo7oi aibakko erokkona; a ogiyaappekka wora boosona.

English Sentences: The murderer rising with the light killeth the poor and needy, and in the night is as a thief.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHemppuwaa woriyaagee wonttimaatti denddidi, hiyyeesatanne metootanchchata worees; qammi qassi kaisodan wuuqqees.

English Sentences: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, saying, No eye shall see me: and disguiseth his face.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaaramuxiyaagee sa7ai lem77anaagaa naagees; i, Ooninne tana be7oppo giidi, ba som77uwaa kammees.

English Sentences: In the dark they dig through houses, which they had marked for themselves in the daytime: they know not the light.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kaisoti qammi keettaa bookkidi, wuuqqanau geloosona; shin gallassi poo7uwaa ixxidi, qosetti pe7oosona.

English Sentences: For the morning is to them even as the shadow of death: if one know them, they are in the terrors of the shadow of death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta gallassa poo7oi yashshees; shin qamma xumai eta daganttenna.

English Sentences: He is swift as the waters; their portion is cursed in the earth: he beholdeth not the way of the vineyards.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iita asata di7o haattai quccidi efees; eta gakkida gadee qanggettidaagaa gidees. Ooninne eta woiniyaa turaa sohuwaa beenna.

English Sentences: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: so doth the grave those which have sinned.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHachchai hombbiyan seerin, awai a melissi xaissiyoogaadan, hegaadankka, nagaranchchati haiqqidi xayoosona.

English Sentences: The womb shall forget him; the worm shall feed sweetly on him; he shall be no more remembered; and wickedness shall be broken as a tree.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hari attin, yelida aayetikka eta hassayokkona. Guxunee eta ashuwaa mal77in mees. Eta iita oosoikka wullida mittaadan meqqana.

English Sentences: He evil entreateth the barren that beareth not: and doeth not good to the widow.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, eti na7i bainna maine maccaasaa naaqqidosona; am77e maccaasaakka maaddennan ixxidosona.

English Sentences: He draweth also the mighty with his power: he riseth up, and no man is sure of life.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai ba wolqqan minota xaissees; i eta bolli denddido wodekka, eti paxa attokkona.

English Sentences: Though it be given him to be in safety, whereon he resteth; yet his eyes are upon their ways.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai eti saro de7anaadan oottikkokka, eta ogiyaa wochchees.

English Sentences: They are exalted for a little while, but are gone and brought low; they are taken out of the way as all other, and cut off as the tops of the ears of corn.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asati guutta wodiyaassi xoqqu xoqqu goosona; shin sohuwaarakka sharafaadan shullidi xayoosona; kattaadan cakettoosona.

English Sentences: And if it be not so now, who will make me a liar, and make my speech nothing worth?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegee hanenna giidi, kaddiya asi de7ii? Taani odido qaalaakka worddo giidi, ammanttiya asi de7ii?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, SHuuha biittaappe yiida Bilddaadi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: Dominion and fear are with him, he maketh peace in his high places.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai wolqqaama gidiyo gishshau, asai yayyidi, ayyo haarettees. I ba saluwaa kawotettaa saruwan naagees.

English Sentences: Is there any number of his armies? and upon whom doth not his light arise?
Wolaitta Sentences: A olanchchata qoodanau danddayiya asi de7ii? Xoossaa poo7oi gakkenna sohoi de7ii? De7enna.

English Sentences: How then can man be justified with God? or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, asi Xoossaa sinttan waani xillo gidanau danddayii? Maccaasappe yelettida asi waani wogaadan geeshsha gidanau danddayii?

English Sentences: Behold even to the moon, and it shineth not; yea, the stars are not pure in his sight.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa sinttan aginaikka wagagga poo7o gidenna; a sinttan xoolinttetikka geeshsha gidokkona.

English Sentences: How much less man, that is a worm? and the son of man, which is a worm?
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatin, Xoossaa sinttan uu7enne guxune gidiya asi ai keena laafee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: But Job answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Iyyoobi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: How hast thou helped him that is without power? how savest thou the arm that hath no strength?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Wolqqi bainna asa neeni aiba maado maaddadii! Daafurida qeeseta neeni aiba ashetta ashshadii!

English Sentences: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom? and how hast thou plentifully declared the thing as it is?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettai bainnaagaa aiba zore zoradii! Ai keena gita eratettaa qonccissadii!

English Sentences: To whom hast thou uttered words? and whose spirit came from thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni ha qaalaa haasayanaadan nena oonee maaddidai? Qassi hagaadan haasayanau nena denttettidaagee o ayyaanee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Dead things are formed from under the waters, and the inhabitants thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Bilddaadi, "Haiqqidaageetu moitilleti biittaappe garssa baggaara haattaa giddon kokkoroosona.

English Sentences: Hell is naked before him, and destruction hath no covering.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa sinttan Si7ooleekka qoncce; aibinne a genttanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: He stretcheth out the north over the empty place, and hangeth the earth upon nothing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai huuphessa bagga salota micciis; sa7aakka aibakko bainnasan kaqqiis.

English Sentences: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; and the cloud is not rent under them.
Wolaitta Sentences: I shaaratun haattaa kunttees; kunttin haattaa deexuwan shaarati daakettokkona.

English Sentences: He holdeth back the face of his throne, and spreadeth his cloud upon it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Goobanida aginaa i ba shaaran kammees.

English Sentences: He hath compassed the waters with bounds, until the day and night come to an end.
Wolaitta Sentences: Poo7uwaa xumaappe shaakkanau, saloi sa7aara danttettiyoosan qammainne gallassai laamettiyo zawaa Xoossai essees.

English Sentences: The pillars of heaven tremble and are astonished at his reproof.
Wolaitta Sentences: I seeriyo wode, salotu tuuqeti dagamau kokkoroosona.

English Sentences: He divideth the sea with his power, and by his understanding he smiteth through the proud.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba wolqqan abbaa co77u oottiis; ba akeekan Ra7aaba giyo miimminttiyaa xaissiis.

English Sentences: By his spirit he hath garnished the heavens; his hand hath formed the crooked serpent.
Wolaitta Sentences: I shemppiyo shemppuwan saloti geeyidosona; a kusheekka xonggettiya shooshshaa woriis.

English Sentences: Lo, these are parts of his ways: but how little a portion is heard of him? but the thunder of his power who can understand?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hageeti ubbai Xoossai oottido oosotuppe amaridaageeta; nuuni siyoogee saasuketta xalaala. Yaatin, a wolqqaa gitatettaa akeekanau danddayiyai oonee?" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaagin Iyyoobi hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: As God liveth, who hath taken away my judgment; and the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta suure pirddaa tana diggidi, ta de7uwaa camo kessida, Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossan taani caaqqais.

English Sentences: All the while my breath is in me, and the spirit of God is in my nostrils;
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai taayyo de7o shemppuwaa immido keenan,

English Sentences: My lips shall not speak wickedness, nor my tongue utter deceit.
Wolaitta Sentences: ta doonai wordduwaa haasayenna; ta inxxarssaikka cimuwaa odenna.

English Sentences: God forbid that I should justify you: till I die I will not remove mine integrity from me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte haasayidoogee likke gaada taani ekkikke; haiqqana gakkanaassikka taani tana suure giyoogaa aggikke.

English Sentences: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: my heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta xillotettaa mintta oiqqanaappe attin, xillotettaa aggikke; taani de7ido laitta ubban ta wozanai kahai tana walassenna.

English Sentences: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, and he that riseth up against me as the unrighteous.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta morkketinne tanaara eqettiyaageeti ubbai iitanne mooranchcha asaadan qaxxayettona.

English Sentences: For what is the hope of the hypocrite, though he hath gained, when God taketh away his soul?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai eta shemppuwaa eta ashuwaappe shaakkidi, eta laittaa qanttiyo wode, iitatuyyo sinttanaa ufaissi aibee?

English Sentences: Will God hear his cry when trouble cometh upon him?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta bolli metoi gakkiyo wode, Xoossai eta waasuwaa siyii?

English Sentences: Will he delight himself in the Almighty? will he always call upon God?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossan eti ufaittanee? Eti ubba wode Xoossaa xeesanee?

English Sentences: I will teach you by the hand of God: that which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani inttena Xoossaa wolqqaabaa tamaarissana; Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa matan de7iyaabaa taani intteppe qottikke.

English Sentences: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; why then are ye thus altogether vain?
Wolaitta Sentences: Intte ubbai hagaa intte huuphen be7ideta. Yaatin, ha hada haasayaa aissi haasayeetii?

English Sentences: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, and the heritage of oppressors, which they shall receive of the Almighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai iita asatuyyo battido qaadainne huqqunniya asati Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaappe ekkiyo woitoi hagaappe kaalliyaagaa.

English Sentences: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword: and his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta naati ai keenaa darikkonne, eti olan wuroosona; eta zaretikka miyoobaa xayidi namisettoosona.

English Sentences: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death: and his widows shall not weep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe attidaageeti boshan wuroosona; eta am77etikka etayyo yeekkokkona.

English Sentences: Though he heap up silver as the dust, and prepare raiment as the clay;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iita asati, qoodin wurenna biraa shiishshinkka, eta biraa suure asati shaakki ekkana;

English Sentences: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, and the innocent shall divide the silver.
Wolaitta Sentences: qassi maayuwaa darissidi shiishshinkka, eti shiishshiyoogaa xilloti maayana.

English Sentences: He buildeth his house as a moth, and as a booth that the keeper maketh.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti keexxiyo keettati shararootiyaa keettaa mala; naagiyaageeti keexxido zamppaa mala.

English Sentences: The rich man shall lie down, but he shall not be gathered: he openeth his eyes, and he is not.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Eti dure gididi, bantta hiixan zin77ana; shin eti xiskkuwaappe beegottiyo wode, aibinne xayin mela attana.

English Sentences: Terrors take hold on him as waters, a tempest stealeth him away in the night.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dagamai di7uwaadan qoppennan eta bolli yaana; qammankka gotee eta denttidi efaana.

English Sentences: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth: and as a storm hurleth him out of his place.
Wolaitta Sentences: Arshsho bagga carkkoi eta de7iyoosaappe pittidi efaana.

English Sentences: For God shall cast upon him, and not spare: he would fain flee out of his hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti kessi ekkanau baqatishin, qareti bainnan eta bolli wodhdhana.

English Sentences: Men shall clap their hands at him, and shall hiss him out of his place.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wodhdhidi wolqqaama cenggurssaa sissiiddi, eta yedettana.

English Sentences: Surely there is a vein for the silver, and a place for gold where they fine it.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Biraa bookki kessiyoosainne worqqaa geeshshanau seerissiyoosai de7ees.

English Sentences: Iron is taken out of the earth, and brass is molten out of the stone.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biratai asai biittaappe bookkin kiyees; nahaaseekka a shuchchaa seerissin kiyees.

English Sentences: He setteth an end to darkness, and searcheth out all perfection: the stones of darkness, and the shadow of death.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai xomppiyaa ehiidi, xumaa xoonees; biittaa xaggaa gakkidi, sakkana xumaa giddon he shuchchaa koyees.

English Sentences: The flood breaketh out from the inhabitant; even the waters forgotten of the foot: they are dried up, they are gone away from men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai de7iyoosaappe haakkidi, asaa tohoi yedhdhi erennasaa biidi, hegan ciimma ollaa bookkees; bookkidi hegan wodoruwan yaanne haanne kuulumuliiddi, asaappe shaahettidi de7ees.

English Sentences: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread: and under it is turned up as it were fire.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kattai biittaappe mokkees; shin he biittaa giddoi taman seeridi, aadhdhi aadhdhi wodhdhees.

English Sentences: The stones of it are the place of sapphires: and it hath dust of gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: He biittaa giddon de7iya shuchchaappe sampperiyaa giyo al77o shuchchai kiyees; a baanaa giddoppekka kulkka worqqai beettees.

English Sentences: There is a path which no fowl knoweth, and which the vulture's eye hath not seen:
Wolaitta Sentences: "He shuchchaa bookkiyoosaa efiya ogiyaa xinggillee erenna; gaceekka be7ibeenna.

English Sentences: The lion's whelps have not trodden it, nor the fierce lion passed by it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanttaara do7ati bantta tohuwan he sohuwaa yedhdhi erokkona; gaammoikka hegaara kanttenna.

English Sentences: He putteth forth his hand upon the rock; he overturneth the mountains by the roots.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asi mino zaallaa mentterettees; deriyaakka bookkidi, xaphuwaappe aatti yeggees.

English Sentences: He cutteth out rivers among the rocks; and his eye seeth every precious thing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Zaallaa lukkidi, kanttiyo ogiyaa kessidi, he al77o shuchchaakka demmees.

English Sentences: He bindeth the floods from overflowing; and the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haattai he sohuwau goggennaadan zeerees; geemmidabatakka poo7uwau kessees.

English Sentences: But where shall wisdom be found? and where is the place of understanding?
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin aadhdhida eratettai awappe beettanau danddayii? Akeekai beettiyoosai awee?

English Sentences: Man knoweth not the price thereof; neither is it found in the land of the living.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi a tumu waagaa erenna; aissi giikko, aadhdhida eratettai paxa de7iyaageetu giddon beettanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: The depth saith, It is not in me: and the sea saith, It is not with me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Abbaa ciimmai, Aadhdhida eratettai ta giddon baawa yaagees.

English Sentences: It cannot be gotten for gold, neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Aadhdhida eratettai worqqan woikko biran shamettenna.

English Sentences: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, with the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettai muruta worqqan, maragidiyaanne sampperiyaa geetettiya al77o shuchchan shamettenna.

English Sentences: The gold and the crystal cannot equal it: and the exchange of it shall not be for jewels of fine gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Worqqainne heregaappe oosettida miishshatu waagai aara likettenna; worqqaappe oosettida al77obankka laamettenna.

English Sentences: No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls: for the price of wisdom is above rubies.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aadhdhida eratettaa waagai zaagooliyaappe, almmaaziyaappenne inqqo ubbaappe aadhdhees.

English Sentences: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tophaaziyooniyaa giyo Toophphiyaa inqqoikka aara likettenna; muruta worqqankka shamettenna.

English Sentences: Whence then cometh wisdom? and where is the place of understanding?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yaatin, aadhdhida eratettai auppe yii? Akeekai beettiyoosai awee?

English Sentences: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, and kept close from the fowls of the air.
Wolaitta Sentences: Paxa de7iya mereta ubbaappe geemmi uttiis; saluwaa kafotikka a demmokkona.

English Sentences: Destruction and death say, We have heard the fame thereof with our ears.
Wolaitta Sentences: Bashshainne haiqoi, Nuuni aadhdhida eratettau odo xalaalaa nu haittan siyida yaagoosona.

English Sentences: God understandeth the way thereof, and he knoweth the place thereof.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Aadhdhida eratettaakko efiya ogiyaanne i de7iyo sohuwaa eriyai Xoossaa xalaala.

English Sentences: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, and seeth under the whole heaven;
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, Xoossai sa7aa gaxaa ubbaa xeellees; xeellidi salotuppe garssaara de7iyaabaa ubbaa be7ees.

English Sentences: To make the weight for the winds; and he weigheth the waters by measure.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai carkkuwaassi wolqqaa immido wodenne shaaraa haattaa likkido wode,

English Sentences: When he made a decree for the rain, and a way for the lightning of the thunder:
Wolaitta Sentences: iraikka awan bukkanaakko, dadaikka awan wodhdhanaakko wogaa wottido wode,

English Sentences: Then did he see it, and declare it; he prepared it, yea, and searched it out.
Wolaitta Sentences: i he wode, aadhdhida eratettaa be7iis; be7idi paacciis; paaccidi, lo77o giis.

English Sentences: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the LORD, that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Xoossai asaassi odiiddi, Xoossaassi yayyiyoogee aadhdhida eratetta; iitaappe haakkiyoogeekka akeeka yaagees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Moreover Job continued his parable, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobi qassikka hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Oh that I were as in months past, as in the days when God preserved me;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha77i ta de7iyo duussai Xoossai beni tana naagido wodiyaagaa mala gideerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: When his candle shined upon my head, and when by his light I walked through darkness;
Wolaitta Sentences: A xomppee ta bolli poo7in, taani a poo7uwan hemettaas.

English Sentences: As I was in the days of my youth, when the secret of God was upon my tabernacle;
Wolaitta Sentences: He wodee Xoossai tananne ta so asaa naagin, taani ta kumetta wolqqaara de7ido wode.

English Sentences: When the Almighty was yet with me, when my children were about me;
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai tanaara de7ees; ta naatikka ta yuushuwan de7oosona.

English Sentences: When I washed my steps with butter, and the rock poured me out rivers of oil;
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ta kushiyaa maattan meecettaas; ta gaacciyo woxaappekka zaitee shaafaadan goggiis.

English Sentences: When I went out to the gate through the city, when I prepared my seat in the street!
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani kataman de7iya pirdda keettaa biido wode, daannatuura issippe uttaas.

English Sentences: The young men saw me, and hid themselves: and the aged arose, and stood up.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode yelagati tana be7idi, ogiyaa immidosona; cimatikka tana bonchchanau denddidi eqqidosona.

English Sentences: The princes refrained talking, and laid their hand on their mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Halaqati haasayiyoogaa aggi bayidosona; bantta doonankka bantta kushiyaa wottidosona.

English Sentences: The nobles held their peace, and their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: He kataman de7iya gita asatikka co77u giidosona; eta inxxarssaikka eta kookkiyaa baqqi oiqqiis.

English Sentences: When the ear heard me, then it blessed me; and when the eye saw me, it gave witness to me:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Tabaa siyidaageetinne tana be7idaageeti ubbai tana galatidi haasayidosona.

English Sentences: Because I delivered the poor that cried, and the fatherless, and him that had none to help him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, maaduwaassi waassiya hiyyeesatanne aawai aayyiyaa xayin, maaddiyaabi bainnaageeta taani ashshaas.

English Sentences: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me: and I caused the widow's heart to sing for joy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiqqana haniya bitanee tana anjjiis; am77iyaakka ta maaduwan ufaittaasu.

English Sentences: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: my judgment was as a robe and a diadem.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani xillotettaa maayodan maayaas; suure pirddaikka ta afala malanne qumaashsha mala.

English Sentences: I was eyes to the blind, and feet was I to the lame.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani qooqetuyyo aife, wobbetuyyo toho gidaas.

English Sentences: I was a father to the poor: and the cause which I knew not I searched out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hiyyeesatuyyo aawa gidaas; taani erenna asatuyyookka xabaqa gidaas.

English Sentences: And I brake the jaws of the wicked, and plucked the spoil out of his teeth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani iitatu gappataa menttaas; eti shankkatidi oiqqidoogeetakka eta doonaappe wotta ekkaas.

English Sentences: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, and I shall multiply my days as the sand.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, taani ta qofan, Taani lo77o, adussa laittaa ta so asaa gidduwan de7ada haiqqana.

English Sentences: My root was spread out by the waters, and the dew lay all night upon my branch.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani ba xaphota haattaa giddo yeddidanne xaazai qamma ubban a tashiyaa bolli de7iyo mittaa mala.

English Sentences: My glory was fresh in me, and my bow was renewed in my hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ubbatonkka bonchchettada de7ana; ta wolqqaikka ubbaton ooraxxana gaada qoppaas.

English Sentences: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, and kept silence at my counsel.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani haasayiyoogaa asai sirphphi gi ezggidi, ta zoriyaa ekkiis.

English Sentences: After my words they spake not again; and my speech dropped upon them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani haasayidoogaappe guyyiyan, eti zaarettidi haasayibookkona; aissi giikko, ta qaalai eta wozanan xokkiis.

English Sentences: And they waited for me as for the rain; and they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
Wolaitta Sentences: Goshshanchchai iraa naagiyoogaadan, eti taani haasayanaagaa siyanau hanggidi naagidosona.

English Sentences: If I laughed on them, they believed it not; and the light of my countenance they cast not down.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti hirggi uttidaashin, taani ta som77uwaa pashkkissaas; hegan eti minettidosona.

English Sentences: I chose out their way, and sat chief, and dwelt as a king in the army, as one that comforteth the mourners.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani eti de7ana ogiyaa dooraas; doorada eta halaqadan uttaas. Ba olanchchatu giddon de7iya kawuwaadan, taani eta giddon de7aas. Qassi azzaniyaageeta minttettiya asa mala gidaas.

English Sentences: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, whose fathers I would have disdained to have set with the dogs of my flock.
Wolaitta Sentences: "SHin ha77i taappe yelagiya asati tana baceessoosona. Eti ta dorssaa wudiyaa heemmiya kanata maaddana ginkka taani diggido aawatu naata.

English Sentences: Yea, whereto might the strength of their hands profit me, in whom old age was perished?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta aawati wolqqi ixxidoogeetanne bolli gilqqidoogeeta gidido gishshau, tana ainne maaddibookkona.

English Sentences: For want and famine they were solitary; fleeing into the wilderness in former time desolate and waste.
Wolaitta Sentences: Metuwaanne namisaa gaasuwan qammi denddidi, bazzo biiddi, xaphuwaa coommidosona.

English Sentences: Who cut up mallows by the bushes, and juniper roots for their meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi sharafaanne bonccuwaa maxidosona; mal77enna sankkaaraa xaphotakka miidosona.

English Sentences: They were driven forth from among men, (they cried after them as after a thief;)
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai waassiiddi, kaisota yedettidoogaadan, asaa giddoppe eta yedettiis.

English Sentences: To dwell in the cliffs of the valleys, in caves of the earth, and in the rocks.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti zanggaaraa giddon, gonggolo giddooninne zaalla kooppo giddon de7idosona.

English Sentences: Among the bushes they brayed; under the nettles they were gathered together.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti buuraa giddon bazzo do7atudan waassidosona; doobbiyaa garssan shiiqidi, issippe de7idosona.

English Sentences: They were children of fools, yea, children of base men: they were viler than the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti xurqqayyiyan shocettidi, biittaappe goodettidosona. Eti sunttaara moorettidi, eeyya gididi de7idosona.

English Sentences: And now am I their song, yea, I am their byword.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ha77i eta naati tana yettan qilliiccoosona; taani eta giddon leemisidi odiyoobaa gidaas.

English Sentences: They abhor me, they flee far from me, and spare not to spit in my face.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti tana shenetidi, taappe haakkoosona; ainne yeellatennan ta som77uwan cuchchaa cuchchoosona.

English Sentences: Because he hath loosed my cord, and afflicted me, they have also let loose the bridle before me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ta wolqqaa laafettidi, tana kaushshido gishshau, eti tana qohanau, bixaalaa kessirggido paraadan, yeda gididosona.

English Sentences: Upon my right hand rise the youth; they push away my feet, and they raise up against me the ways of their destruction.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha seeri bainnan diccida naati ta bolli denddidi, tana yedettoosona; eti tana xaissanau ta bolli woraajjoosona.

English Sentences: They mar my path, they set forward my calamity, they have no helper.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ta hemettiyo ogiyaa gorddidi, tana xaissanau koyoosona; ooninne eti hegaa oottanaagaa diggenna.

English Sentences: They came upon me as a wide breaking in of waters: in the desolation they rolled themselves upon me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Olanchchati katamaa dirssaa menttidi geliyoogaadan, eti ta bolli yiidosona.

English Sentences: Terrors are turned upon me: they pursue my soul as the wind: and my welfare passeth away as a cloud.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gita dagamai tana hitti oottiis; ta bonchchoikka carkkoi efiyoobaadan biis; ta ishaloikka shaaraadan xayiis.

English Sentences: And now my soul is poured out upon me; the days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta shemppiyaa hitaasu; tuggaa gallassai tana cirppintti oiqqiis.

English Sentences: My bones are pierced in me in the night season: and my sinews take no rest.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qammi qammi sahoi ta meqettaa coommees; seelaikka shemppi ekkennan gede gujjees.

English Sentences: By the great force of my disease is my garment changed: it bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta maayoi gunddidi moorettiis; qoliyaa qooriyaadan, tana cuulli oiqqiis.

English Sentences: He hath cast me into the mire, and I am become like dust and ashes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai tana urqqan oliis; olin taani biittaappe bidinttaappe kehenna asa gidaas.

English Sentences: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not hear me: I stand up, and thou regardest me not.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abeet Xoossau, taani neeyyo waassais; shin neeni taayyo allabaakka. Eqqada nena woossaas; shin neeni ta woosaa siyabaakka.

English Sentences: Thou art become cruel to me: with thy strong hand thou opposest thyself against me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni kaseegaappe dummatada, taayyo meqettaa iitadasa; ne gita wolqqan tana yedettaasa.

English Sentences: Thou liftest me up to the wind; thou causest me to ride upon it, and dissolvest my substance.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni tana carkkuwan denttadasa; denttada a togissadasa; gotiyankka tana suragissadasa.

English Sentences: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, and to the house appointed for all living.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asau ubbau wurssetta gidida haiquwau neeni tana aattada immiyoogaa taani erais.

English Sentences: Howbeit he will not stretch out his hand to the grave, though they cry in his destruction.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Kunddidi meqqida asi tuggatiiddi, Tana maaddarkkii giidi waassin, au qarettenna asi de7ii?

English Sentences: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? was not my soul grieved for the poor?
Wolaitta Sentences: Tuggan de7iyaageetuyyo taani yeekkabeikkinaa? Hiyyeesatuyyo taani qarettabeikkinaa?

English Sentences: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Lo77obaa demmana gaada taani amottiyo wode, iitabai tana gakkiis. Taayyo sa7ai kehees gaada taani naagiyo wode, gallassai taayyo xumiis.

English Sentences: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta wozanai hirggiis; taani woppaa demmabeikke; gallassaappe gallassan ta tuggai yaa dariis.

English Sentences: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta bollai awaa suuluwan gidennan azzanuwan karexxiis; taani shiiquwan eqqada, Tana maaddite! gaada waassais.

English Sentences: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani worakanatuyyo isha, yanchchatuyyookka dabbo gidaas.

English Sentences: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta gogai xiiximmidi, poqetti poqetti wodhdhees; ta bollaikka mishuwan xuugettees.

English Sentences: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, ta maazinqqee zilaassau diixettiis; ta imbbiliiteekka yeehuwau punettiis.

English Sentences: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Maccaasa xeellada amottennaadan, taani ta aifiyaara maachchaa maacettaas.

English Sentences: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?
