Wolaitta Sentences: Taani hegaa oottidabaa gidiyaakko, bollan de7iya Xoossai taayyo aiba qaada immanddeeshsha? Saluwan de7iya Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai asaassi immiyo woitoi aiba gidanddeeshsha?

English Sentences: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitatu bolli boshai, mooruwaa oottiyaageetu bolli bashshai gakkanaagee erettidaagaa gidenneeyye?

English Sentences: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ta hemetaa ubbaa be7ees; ta tangguwaa ubbaakka qoodees.

English Sentences: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani iitabaa mulekka oottabeikke; asakka cimmanau kajjeelabeikke.

English Sentences: Let me be weighed in an even balance that God may know mine integrity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai tana likke meezaanan mazzano; yaatidi taani xillo gidiyoogaa ero.

English Sentences: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta hemetai ogiyaappe sher77idabaa gidikko, ta wozanaikka ta aifee xeellidobaa amottidabaa gidikkonne, qassi ta kusheekka nagaran tunidabaa gidikko,

English Sentences: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.
Wolaitta Sentences: ta carshshai ubbai shodetti xayo; taani zeridobaakka harai mo.

English Sentences: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour's door;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta wozanai ta shooruwaa maccaasa amottidaba gidikko, woikko taani i penggen zuggada naagidabaa gidikko,

English Sentences: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.
Wolaitta Sentences: ta keettaayyiyaa hara asau gaaccu; qassi hara attuma asati iira zin77ona.

English Sentences: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, shaaramuxiyoogee keehippe pokkonne pirddan qaxxayissiya nagara.

English Sentences: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha nagarai tamaadan xuuggidi, ta aquwaa ubbaa xaissiyaabaa.

English Sentences: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani ta attuma woikko ta macca ashkkarati tana mootin, eta mootuwaa karidabaa gidikko,

English Sentences: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai tana pirddiyo wode, taani waananee? Qassi i tana oichchiyo wode, taani woiga zaaranee?

English Sentences: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, tana medhdhida Xoossai ta ashkkaratakka i medhdhiis. Nuna ubbaakka nu aayee nu aayee uluwan tilidaagee issi a xalaalaa.

English Sentences: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani hiyyeesati woossidobaa diggabeikke; woikko am77eta minttettennan agga erikke.

English Sentences: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;
Wolaitta Sentences: Aawai aayyiyaa bainna naati mela aqiyo wode, taani ta qumaa tarkka mabeikke.

English Sentences: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb;)
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani eta ta yelagatettaappe doommada, eta aawadan dichchaas; ta aayee uluwaappe yelettoosappe doommada, am77eta maaddaas.

English Sentences: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;
Wolaitta Sentences: Maayoi xayin, meegoi woriyo uraa, woikko kallo de7iya metootanchcha demmiyo wode,

English Sentences: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
Wolaitta Sentences: ta dorssatu ikisiyaappe oosettida maayuwaa taani etau immennan agga erikke. Hegaa gishshau, etikka bantta polo wozanan tana galatoosona.

English Sentences: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani mootuwan eta shatimmanaagaa erada, aawi bainna naata naaqqidabaa gidikko,

English Sentences: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.
Wolaitta Sentences: ta qesee kuriyaappe meqqo; ta kusheekka hashiyaappe karetti wodhdho.

English Sentences: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa taani oottennaagee Xoossaa qixaatiyaassi yayyiyo gishshaassanne a anggai tana daganttiyo gishshaassa.

English Sentences: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani worqqan ammanettido wodee baawa. Muruta worqqaakka, Taani nenan ceeqettais gabeikke.

English Sentences: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta duretettaa daruwan, ta kushee demmido woriyan taani ufaittabeikke.

English Sentences: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;
Wolaitta Sentences: Awaa phoolettaa woikko aginaa lo77otettaa be7ada,

English Sentences: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:
Wolaitta Sentences: ta wozanan geeman eta bonchchabeikke, woikko ta kushiyaa piddi ootta yerada, etau goinnabeikke.

English Sentences: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani hegaa oottidaakko, Xoossaa kaddaas shin. He nagaraikka pirddan qaxxayissiya nagara.

English Sentences: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta morkketa gakkida iita qaadan taani ufaittabeikke; eta gakkida metuwankka hombbocabeikke.

English Sentences: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta morkkee xayo yaaga qanggada, nagara oottabeikke.

English Sentences: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ubbaton imattaa mokkiyoogaa ta ashkkarati taayyo markkattoosona.

English Sentences: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7ai qammido asa karen aissabeikke; taani ta keettaa penggiyaa ogiyaara biyaagau ubbatoo dooya wottaas.

English Sentences: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai qosiyoogaadan, taani ta nagaraa ta shophphan qosabeikke.

English Sentences: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani asaa haasayaassi dagammabeikke; eta boriyaassi yayyada, taani co77u giido wodeenne kare kiyennan aggido wodee baawa.

English Sentences: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani haasayiyoogaa siyiyaabi de7eerenneeshsha! Taani haasayidobai ubbai tuma gidiyoogau taani paramais; Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai taayyo zaaruwaa immo. Ta baarigaarai tana mootido pailee de7in, wai be7arkkinaashsha!

English Sentences: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7iyaakko, woitodan taani ta hashiyan sikkana shin! Kallachchadan ta huuphiyan goxxana shin!

English Sentences: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani halaqadan akko shiiqada, ta oottidobaa ubbaa ayyo yootana shin!

English Sentences: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ta goshsha biittai, Tana bonqqa ekkadasa! giidi, ta bolli waassidabaa gidikko, ta yafaratikka ta bolli yeekkidabaa gidikko,

English Sentences: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:
Wolaitta Sentences: he biittan mokkidaagaa miishsha qanxxennan coo miidabaa gidikko, woikko he biittaa oottiyaageeta namisan woridaba gidikko,

English Sentences: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
Wolaitta Sentences: taayyo gisttiyaa gishshaa agunttai, banggaa gishshaakka sharafai he biittan mokko" yaagiis. Iyyooba haasayai hagan polettiis.

English Sentences: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobi, "Taani xillo asa" giido gishshau, ha heezzu asati ayyo zaaruwaa immiyoogaa aggi bayidosona.

English Sentences: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobi Xoossaa xillo giyoogaa aggidi, bana xillo oottido gishshau, Raama yara gidiya Buuziyaa Barkkeela na7ai Eelihu Iyyooba bolli keehippe hanqqettiis.

English Sentences: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eelihu qassi Iyyooba heezzu laggetakka hanqqettiis; aissi giikko, eti a coo mooranchcha giidosonappe attin, ayyo zirxxa zaaro zaaranau danddayibookkona.

English Sentences: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eelihu etappe kaalotiyo gishshau, eti ubbai haasayaa wurssana gakkanaashin naagiis.

English Sentences: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha heezzu asati Iyyoobayyo gidiya zaaruwaa immanau danddayibeennaagaa be7idi, i keehippe hanqqettiis.

English Sentences: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hanqqettidi Buuziyaa Barkkeela na7ai Eelihu hagaadan yaagidi, haasayaa doommiis; "Taani laittan naatais; intte taappe cimeeta. Hegaa gishshau, taani ta qofaa intteyyo yootanau yayyaas.

English Sentences: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani, Cimati haasayona; bantta daro laittan demmido aadhdhida eratettaa tamaarissona gaada qoppaas.

English Sentences: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin asa giddon aqidi, aadhdhida eratettaa asassi immiyaagee Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa Ayyaanaa.

English Sentences: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asaa aadhdhida eranchcha kessiyaagee cimatetta gidenna, woikko likkebai geliyoi daro de7ida asatussa gidenna.

English Sentences: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, siyite; taanikka ta qofaa intteyyo yootana.

English Sentences: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Be7ite, intte haasayiyo wode, taani co77u gaada ezggaas; intte haasayana qaalaa qoppishinkka naagaas.

English Sentences: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani intte giyoogaa ubbaa wurssa siyaas; shin intteppe ooninne Iyyoobi mooranchcha giidi ammanttibeenna; qassi intteppe ooninne a palamau bessiya zaaruwaa immibeenna.

English Sentences: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyooba haasayaayyo kalissiya zaaruwaa zaaranai Xoossaappe attin, asa gidenna gishshau, intte, Nuuni aadhdhida eratettaa demmida geennaadan naagettite.

English Sentences: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobi palamettidoogee inttenaarappe attin, tanaara gidenna. Taani intte haasayidoogaadan ayyo zaaruwaa immikke.

English Sentences: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, eti dagammidi, ne haasayaassi zaaruwaa immanau danddayibookkona; etau haasayiyoobai xayiis.

English Sentences: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti haasayiyoobaa xayidi, co77u giidi eqqikko, taanikka naaganau koshshii?

English Sentences: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.
Wolaitta Sentences: CHii, chii, taayyookka yootiyoobai de7ees; taanikka ta qofaa yootana.

English Sentences: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani daro haasayiyoobai de7iyo gishshau, ta giddon de7iya ayyaanai tana oda giidi giddees.

English Sentences: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7ite, taayyo haasayiyo kayai imettennabaa gidikko, taani ho77o woine eessai kumido ogoruwaadan xuuqqana hanais.

English Sentences: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taayyo hagaappe guuttaa kehana mala, taani haasayanau koshshees; ta doonaakka dooyada, taani ta zaaruwaa immanau koshshees.

English Sentences: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha yohuwan taani oonanne maaddikke, woikko ai asanne coo sabbikke.

English Sentences: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, asa coo sabbiyoobi taayyo mulekka erettenna. Taani qassi hegaa hanikko, tana Medhdhidaagee tana qaxxayana.

English Sentences: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, ha77i taani yootiyoogaa siya; ta giyoobaa ubbaakka ezgga.

English Sentences: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani haasayanau giigaas; ta qaalatikka ta inxxarssaa xeeran de7oosona.

English Sentences: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta haasayiyo qaalati ta wozanaa suuretettaa qonccissoosona; taani eriyoogaa ta inxxarssai tumatettan haasayees.

English Sentences: The spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tana Xoossaa Ayyaanai medhdhiis; Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa shemppoi taayyo de7uwaa immiis.

English Sentences: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni danddayiyaaba gidikko, taayyo zaaruwaa imma; nena giigissada, tanaara gaitta.

English Sentences: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Be7a, taani Xoossaa sinttan ne mala; qassi taanikka urqqaappe merettaas.

English Sentences: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni taassi yayyiyo gaasoi baawa; taani nena naaqqikke.

English Sentences: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ne haasayaa ubbaa taani ezggaidda takkaas; neeni hagaadan yaagishin siyaas;

English Sentences: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani geeshshanne boree bainna asa; taani xillonne nagara oottabeenna asa.

English Sentences: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin Xoossai tana qaxxayanau gaasuwaa koyees; i tana ba morkkedan qoodees.

English Sentences: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ta tohuwaa toho biratan qachchees; taani tanggiyo tanggo ubbaakka i wochchees yaagadasa.

English Sentences: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, neeni ha haasayan likke gidakka! Ane taani neeyyo yootais; Xoossai asappe aadhdhees.

English Sentences: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni, Xoossai taani haasayido haasayau zaaruwaa immenna gaada, aissi aara palamettai?

English Sentences: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi akeekennappe attin, Xoossai ha ogiyaarakka he ogiyaarakka haasayees.

English Sentences: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asai qammi hiixan zin77idi, xiskkuwaa kairido wode, Xoossai aimuwaaninne ajjuutan haasayees.

English Sentences: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode asai siyanaadan haittaa dooyees; ba seerankka i eta daganttees.

English Sentences: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatidi asi nagaraa oottennaadan teqqees; otoruwaakka asaappe diggees.

English Sentences: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai asaa bashshaappe ashshees; haiquwaappekka naagees.

English Sentences: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai sakkiya harggiyan asaa oittidikka, asi ba balaappe simmanaadan seerees.

English Sentences: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadan hanidi, harggida uri kattaa ixxees; daro mal77o qumaikka a sheneyees.

English Sentences: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ashoikka gilqqidi wurees; a bollaikka melin, meqettai qoodettees.

English Sentences: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.
Wolaitta Sentences: I haiqqanaunne moogettanau hanees.

English Sentences: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asau suure ogiyaa bessiya, sha7an qoodettiya kiitanchchatuppe issoi ayyo gaannatanau yiyaakko,

English Sentences: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.
Wolaitta Sentences: yiidikka ayyo qarettidi, I duufuwaa gelennaadan a ashsha. Taani ayyo woziyoobaa demmaas yaagiyaakko,

English Sentences: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he shall return to the days of his youth:
Wolaitta Sentences: a bollai yelagana; a yelagatettaa wolqqaikka ayyo simmana.

English Sentences: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.
Wolaitta Sentences: He bitanee Xoossaa woossana; woossin Xoossai a woosaa siyana. Xoossai ayyo a xillotettaa zaariyo gishshau, i ufaissan Xoossaassi goinnana.

English Sentences: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode asaa sinttan i hagaadan yaagidi yexxana; Taani nagaraa oottaas; suurebaakka geellayaas; shin Xoossai ta mooruwaadan taayyo qanxxibeenna.

English Sentences: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani duufuwan gelennaadan tana ashshiis; hekko, ha77i paxa de7ada, poo7uwaa be7ais yaagana.

English Sentences: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Be7ite, Xoossai asaassi hagaa ubbaa zaari zaaridi oottees;

English Sentences: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.
Wolaitta Sentences: hegaadan oottidi, asaa duufuwan geliyoogaappe ashshees; de7uwan i ufaittanaadan oottees.

English Sentences: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Simmi Iyyoobaa, taani yootiyoogaa ezggada siya. Ane neeni co77u gin, taani haasayais.

English Sentences: If thou hast anything to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni haasayanau koyiyoobi de7ikko, taayyo haasaya. Taani neeni xillo gidiyoogaa bessanau koyais.

English Sentences: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegee xayikko, co77u gaada, taani haasayiyoogaa siya. Nena taani aadhdhida eratettaa tamaarissana" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassikka Eelihu hagaadan yaagiis,

English Sentences: Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Inttenoo, aadhdhida eranchchatoo, taani haasayiyo haasayaa siyite. Inttenoo, eranchchatoo, intte haittaa taakko yeggite.

English Sentences: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Inxxarssai qumaa mal77uwaa eriyoogaadan, haittaikka yohuwaa shaakkidi erees.

English Sentences: Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ane nuuni likkebaanne lo77obaa shaakkidi eroos.

English Sentences: For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobi, Taani xillo; shin Xoossai ta suure pirddaa tana diggiis.

English Sentences: Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani likke gidaidda, worddanchchadan qoodettaas. Tanan mooroi bainnankka, i tana paxennaadan masunxxissiis yaagiis.

English Sentences: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossaa bolli Iyyoobadan qilliicciya asi de7ii?

English Sentences: Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.
Wolaitta Sentences: I iitabaa oottiyaageetuura zuppetees; nagaranchchatuurakka hemettees.

English Sentences: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Waanidi giikko, i, Asi Xoossaa ufaissana giidi oottiyoobi ainne maaddenna yaagees.

English Sentences: Therefore hearken unto me ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Hegaa gishshau, inttenoo, akeekanchcha asatoo, taani yootiyoogaa ane siyite! Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai iitabaa mulekka oottenna.

English Sentences: For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai asassi a oosuwaadan immees; aawu ogiyaadan aawussi qanxxees.

English Sentences: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai tumuppe iitabaa oottenna; Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai suure pirddaa geellayenna.

English Sentences: Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7aa bollan Xoossaayyo maataa immidai oonee? Qassi biittaa ubbaa bolli a sunttidai oonee?

English Sentences: If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ba Ayyaanaanne ba de7o shemppuwaa baakko zaaridi ekkiyaakko,

English Sentences: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.
Wolaitta Sentences: asho maayida ubbai issippe xayana; asi biittau duge simmana.

English Sentences: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Intte akeekanchcha gidikko, hagaa siyite; ta haasayiyoogaakka ezggite.

English Sentences: Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?
Wolaitta Sentences: Suure pirddaa ixxiyaagee biittaa haaranau danddayii? Yaatin, neeni xillonne wolqqaama gidiya Xoossaa pirddai?

English Sentences: Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art wicked? and to princes, Ye are ungodly?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai kawota, Intte shufurota yaagees; qassi biittaa haariyaageetakka, Intte iita yaagees.

English Sentences: How much less to him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.
Wolaitta Sentences: Halaqatu som77uwaa xeellidi maaddenna; duriyaakka manqquwaappe aattidi xeellenna. Aissi giikko, eti ubbaikka a oosota.

English Sentences: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti hekka bilahe akeekennan haiqqana; asai ubbaikka kokkoridi xayana; wolqqaamatikka ai asa kusheenne bochchennan kichchana.

English Sentences: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai asaa hemetaa xeellees; a tanggo ubbaakka wochchees.

English Sentences: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitaa oottiyaageeta Xoossaappe genttanau danddayiya sakkana xumi baawa.

English Sentences: For he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai asaa bolli pirddanau, asai a sintti shiiqanaadan keero immenna.

English Sentences: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wolqqaamata ainne oichchennan mentterettees; yaatidi eta sohuwan haraata wottees.

English Sentences: Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
Wolaitta Sentences: I eta oosuwaa eriyo gishshau, eta issi qammi maataappe wottidi xaissees.

English Sentences: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta iitatettaa gishshau, asi ubbi be7iyoosan i eta qaxxayees.

English Sentences: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:
Wolaitta Sentences: Qaxxayiyoogeekka eti a kaallennan ixxidi, a azazuwaakka aggido gishshaassa.

English Sentences: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti hiyyeesata huqqunnidi, eta Xoossaakko waassanaadan oottidosona; oottin Xoossai hiyyeesatu waasuwaa siyiis.

English Sentences: When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai co77u giikko, a pirddanai oonee? I ba som77uwaa wora zaarikko, asa maaddiyaabi baawa.

English Sentences: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaadankka, Xoossaassi yayyenna asati haarennaadaaninne asaassikka gite gidennaadan, asai ubbai digganau danddayenna.

English Sentences: Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, ne nagaraa Xoossaayyo paaxadii? Qassi zaarada nagara oottennaadan geppadii?

English Sentences: That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne mooruwaa neeyyo qonccissana mala, Xoossaa woossadii? Sinttanau iita ooso oottennan agganau maayadii?

English Sentences: Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni Xoossai oottiyoobaa ixxaidda, ne waagai neeni dosiyoogaadan hananau koyai? Simmi qofaa qachchanai nenappe attin, tana gidikke. Hegaa gishshau, neeni qoppiyoobaa taayyo yoota.

English Sentences: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akeekanchcha asati taani yootiyoogaa maayoosona; taani odiyoogaa siyiya aadhdhida eranchchatikka hagaadan yaagoosona;

English Sentences: Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobi eri paccin, hagaa haasayees; i haasayiyoobau birshshettikka baawa yaagoosona.

English Sentences: My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end because of his answers for wicked men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobi iita asatudan zaaruwaa immido gishshau, wurssettaa gakkanau paacettidaa gideerenneeshsha!

English Sentences: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, i ba nagaraa bolli makkalaa gujjees; nu sinttan Xoossaa qilliiccees. Ba qaalaakka darissidi, Xoossaa bolli biddees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Elihu spake moreover, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Eelihu qassikka hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than God's?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, neeni, Taani Xoossaa sinttan xillo giyoogee likkee?

English Sentences: For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi, Taani nagaraa oottikko, nena ai qohiyaanaa? Nagaraa oottennan aggikko, taani go7ettiyoobi aibee? yaagada neeni Xoossaa oichchadasa.

English Sentences: I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani neeyyoonne nenaara de7iya ne laggetuyyo zaaruwaa haasayana.

English Sentences: Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoqqu gaada salota xeella; neeppe bollaara de7iya shaaratakka ane akeekada be7a.

English Sentences: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni nagaraa oottikko, hegee Xoossaa ainne qohenna. Ne mooroi darikkokka, neeni Xoossaa ainne oottakka.

English Sentences: If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? or what receiveth he of thine hand?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xillo gidikko, ayyo neeni ai immuutee? Woikko ne kushiyaappe i ai ekkanee?

English Sentences: Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni nagaraa oottikko, ne mala asaa qohaasa; qassi xillikkokka, asaa go77aasa.

English Sentences: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Huqqunnai darobare asai waassees; wolqqaamatu kushiyaappe kessi ekkanau alluwaa xeegees.

English Sentences: But none saith, Where is God my maker, who giveth songs in the night;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ooninne, Xoossai, tana Medhdhidaagee, qamman mazamuriyaa immidaagee, sa7aa do7atuppe aattidi,

English Sentences: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?
Wolaitta Sentences: nuna tamaarissiyaageenne saluwaa kafotuppe aadhdhida eranchcha nuna oottiyaagee awan de7ii? yaagenna.

English Sentences: There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iita asati waassoosona; shin Xoossai eta otoruwaa gaasuwan, etau allenna.

English Sentences: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hada waasuwaa Xoossai tumuppe siyenna; Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossai hegaa ezggenna.

English Sentences: Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust thou in him.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, neeni, Taani Xoossaa be7anau danddayikke; ta mootoi a sinttan de7ees; taani a naagais yaagaasa. Yaatin, neeyyo i zaaruwaa immanau, ne gaasoi ai keena guuxxanddeeshsha!

English Sentences: But now, because it is not so, he hath visited in his anger; yet he knoweth it not in great extremity:
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai asaa qaxxayennabaanne nagaraakka shenehoo giidi aggiigiyaaba gaada qoppai?

English Sentences: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gidikko, neeni ne doonaa coo mela dooyaasa; dooyadakka eri bainna haasayaa darissaasa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Elihu also proceeded, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Eelihu gujjidikka hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God's behalf.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossaa doona gidada taani neeyyo yootiyoobai biron de7iyo gishshau, guuttaa danddayada siya.

English Sentences: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani ta eraa zaassada ehais; tana Medhdhidaagee xillo gidiyoogaa taani nena erissana.

English Sentences: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani worddo haasayikke; kumetta erai de7iyo uri nenaara de7iyoogaa ammana.

English Sentences: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Be7a, Xoossai wolqqaama; shin i oonanne karenna. I akeekaukka mino.

English Sentences: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitata i paxa wottenna; shin huqqunnettidaageetu maataa i naagissees.

English Sentences: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai ba aifiyaa xillotuppe denttenna. I eta kawotuura utissidi, merinau xoqqu xoqqu oottees.

English Sentences: And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin asai sanssalatan qashettikko, woikko tuggaa wodoruwan oiqettikko,

English Sentences: Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
Wolaitta Sentences: i eta oosuwaanne otoruwan eti oottido nagaraa qonccissees.

English Sentences: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
Wolaitta Sentences: Seeraa siyanaadan eta haittaa dooyees; nagaraappe simmanaadankka i eta azazees.

English Sentences: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti siyidi, ayyo oottikko, bantta laittaa saruwaaninne ufaissan wurssana.

English Sentences: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin eti siyennan ixxikko, olan wurana; eti eraa xayido gishshau haiqqana.

English Sentences: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossaa ammanenna asati bantta wozanan yiilluwaa dagayoosona; i eta qaxxayiyo wodekka, maadda giidi woossokkona.

English Sentences: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti bantta yelagatettan haiqqoosona; eta de7oikka yeellan wurees.

English Sentences: He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai tuggatiyaageeta eta tuggan tamaarissees; i eta metuwaa baggaara eta sissees.

English Sentences: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai nena metuwaappe kessiis; kessidi metoi bainna aaho sohuwaa efiis; ne miyo masoofiyankka modhdhuwaa guuppiis.

English Sentences: But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin ha77i iitatu bolli gakkanau bessiya pirddai ne bolli gakkiiddi de7ees.

English Sentences: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nena ooninne duretettaa bessidi cimmennaadan, daro mattaayiyankka balettennaadan naagetta.

English Sentences: Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne aquwaa daroi woikko ne minotettai nena metuwaappe ashshanee?

English Sentences: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kawotettati bantta sohuwaappe xayiyo qammai yaanaadan amottoppa.

English Sentences: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha metoi ubbai nena gakkidoogee, nena iitaappe ashshanaassa. Hegaa gishshau, iitatettau guyye simmennaadan nena akeeka.

English Sentences: Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai ba wolqqan xoqqu xoqqu giis! A mala asttamaaree oonee?

English Sentences: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?
Wolaitta Sentences: Hagaa ootta giidi Xoossaa azaziya asi, woikko, Neeni iita ooso oottadasa yaaganau danddayiya asi baawa.

English Sentences: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai mazamuriyan sabbido a oosuwaa neenikka sabbanau hassaya.

English Sentences: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.
Wolaitta Sentences: Asai ubbai Xoossaa oosuwaa be7iis; shin be7iiddi, haahuwan be7iis.

English Sentences: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
Wolaitta Sentences: Be7ite, Xoossai gita! A gitatettaa nuuni akeekibookko; a laittaa coratettaikka qoodin gakettenna.

English Sentences: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai haattaa sa7aappe pude saluwaa efees; efiidi yan ira kessees.

English Sentences: Which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.
Wolaitta Sentences: He irai shaaraappe kiyidi, asau daro bukkanaadan oottees.

English Sentences: Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaarai waani yuuyiyaakko, dadaikka Xoossai de7iyo saluwan waani guummiyaakko, ooninne erenna.

English Sentences: Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.
Wolaitta Sentences: I ba yuushuwan wolqqanttaa poo7uwaa laalees; shin abbaa ciimmaa i xuman kammees.

English Sentences: For by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iraa bukissiyoogan ba asaassi daro kattaakka mokissees.

English Sentences: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.
Wolaitta Sentences: I wolqqanttaa ba kushiyan oiqqees; oiqqidi ba halchchido sohuwaa shocanau azazees.

English Sentences: The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dadai guummiyoogee uushoi uushanaagaa awaajjees; meheekka uushoi yiyoogaa erees.

English Sentences: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Uushoi ta wozanaa diddiqissees; ba de7iyo sohuwankka pirees.

English Sentences: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ubbaikka Xoossaa cenggurssaa, dadaadan guummiya a qaalaa siyite.

English Sentences: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: I salo ubbaappe kiittiyo wolqqanttai biittaa gaxaappe gaxaa gakkanaashin beettees.

English Sentences: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, a gunttaa cenggurssai siyettees; ba wolqqaama cenggurssan guummees; a cenggurssai siyettiyo wode, ba wolqqanttaa teqqenna.

English Sentences: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa cenggurssai maalaalissiya gunttaa guummees; nuuni akeekanau danddayenna gitabaa i oottees.

English Sentences: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHachchaa i, Sa7an wodhdha! yaagees; wolqqaama iraakka, Bukka yaagidi azazees.

English Sentences: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Asai ubbai a oosuwaa erana mala, he wode ba oosuwaa oosuwaa agganaadan oottees.

English Sentences: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.
Wolaitta Sentences: He wode do7atikka bantta geessuwaa geessuwaa geloosona; gelidi yan uttoosona.

English Sentences: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tohossa baggappe gotee yees; huuphessa baggappekka meegoi yees.

English Sentences: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai siiriyaara shemppiyo shemppuwaappe shachchai merettees; hegan aaho haattatikka shuchchaadan minnees.

English Sentences: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaarai haattaa tookkanaadan i oottees; ba wolqqanttaakka shaaraa giddon laalees.

English Sentences: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.
Wolaitta Sentences: A kaaletuwan shaarati yuuyi yuuyi aadhdhoosona; i azaziyoobaa ubbaa eti sa7aa bolli oottoosona.

English Sentences: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai iraa bukissiyoogee biittaa irxxissanaassa, woikko asaa qaxxayanaassa, woikko ba siiquwaa eta bessanaassa.

English Sentences: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, hagaa siya; Xoossai oottiyo maalaalissiya oosuwaa takki gaada akeeka.

English Sentences: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai shaarata waati azaziyaakkonne ba wolqqanttaakka waati wolqqanttiyaakko erai?

English Sentences: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaarati saluwan waani toohettiyaakkonne qassi a erai polo gidido Xoossai oottiyo maalaalissiya oosuwaa neeni erai?

English Sentences: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?
Wolaitta Sentences: CHii, tohossa carkkoi yiidi, biittaa mishissiyo wode, neeni hombbiyan metootanaappe attin, mulekka hegaa erakka.

English Sentences: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossai saluwaa heregaadan piddi oottidi micciyo wode, neeni a maaddanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.
Wolaitta Sentences: Nuuni eraa paca gidiyo gishshau, nuuni Xoossaassi woigi haasayanaakko, neeni nuna tamaarissa.

English Sentences: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaara haasayana gaada taani oichchikke. Hagaadan oottada, i tana xaissana mala, taani aissi a dentterettiyaanaa?

English Sentences: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Carkkoi salota pittidi geeshshidoogaappe guyyiyan, salotun phooliya awaa poo7uwaa asi xeellanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Huuphessa baggaara worqqaa milatiya poo7oi beettees; Xoossaikka yashshiya anggan qonccees.

English Sentences: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Nuuni Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaa mati shiiqanau danddayokko; a wolqqai gita. I ba tumu pirddaaninne ba gita xillotettan huqqunnenna.

English Sentences: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, asai ayyo yayyees; banttana aadhdhida eranchcha giyaageeta ubbata i wudenna" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, GODAI gotiyaa giddoppe Iyyoobassi hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Eri bainna haasayan ta zoriyaa tashsha7issiyaagee i hagee oonee?

English Sentences: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ane neeni asadan ne xeessaa gixxa denddada, taani oichchiyoogaa taayyo oda.

English Sentences: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani sa7aa medhdhiyo wode, neeni awan de7ai? Ane neeyyo akeekai de7ikko, taayyo yoota.

English Sentences: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ha sa7ai ai keena gidanau bessiyaakko, he qofaa qachchidai oonee? Likkiyo wodoruwaakka sa7aa bolli yeggidaagee oonee? Hegaa zaaruwaa ubbaa erai?

English Sentences: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7aa tuuqeta kunddennaadan mintti oiqqidabai aibee? Sa7aa baasuwau koiro shuchchaa wottidai oonee?

English Sentences: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?
Wolaitta Sentences: He gallassi maallado xoolintteti issippe yexxidoogaanne kiitanchchati ubbai ufaissau ililidoogaa neeni erai?

English Sentences: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abbaa haattai, biittaa gomppaappe xuuqqidi kiyiyo gallassi, a penggeta gorddidaagee oonee?

English Sentences: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,
Wolaitta Sentences: Abbaa shaaraa maizzidaagee, qassi xumankka xaaxa wottidaagee tana.

English Sentences: And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,
Wolaitta Sentences: Abbaayyo kanttenna zawaa medhdhidaagee, a penggiyaanne a hiraquwaa sohuwan wottidaagee tana.

English Sentences: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani, Hagaa gakka; shin hagaappe aadhdhoppa; ne wolqqaama beetaikka hegan eqqo yaagaas.

English Sentences: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, neeni yelettoosappe awai maallado guuraara kiyanaadan azaza erai?

English Sentences: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?
Wolaitta Sentences: Biittaa xanxxan poo7uwaa bessana malanne iita asatakka eti qosettidosaappe qoncciyaa kessana mala, neeni wonttaa azaza erai?

English Sentences: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.
Wolaitta Sentences: Gallassaa poo7oi zumatanne zanggaarata dakkoyidi wottido maayoi eqqidabaadan beettanaadan oottees; qassi urqqa miishshaa bolli wottido maatafaadan geeshshidi bessees.

English Sentences: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iitati banttau poo7o gi wottido xumai xayees; eti makkalau denttiyo kusheekka meqqees.

English Sentences: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Ciimma abbaa giddo gelada, pulttuwaa be7adii? Woikko asi gakki erenna abbaa gidduwaa paacca xeella erai?

English Sentences: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?
Wolaitta Sentences: Haiquwaa penggeta nena oonakko bessidee? Woikko sakkana xumaa penggeta be7adii?

English Sentences: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.
Wolaitta Sentences: Sa7ai ai keena gitakko erai? Hegaa ubbaa neeni eriyaabaa gidikko, taayyo yoota.

English Sentences: Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Poo7oi de7iyoosaa efiya ogee awan de7ii? Qassi xumai de7iyo sohoi awee?

English Sentences: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta neeni eta soo soo efaanau danddayai? Eti de7iyoosaa efiya ogeta neeni erai?

English Sentences: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni sa7ai merettiyo wode yelettido gishshaunne daro laittaakka de7ido gishshau, hegaa erennan aggakka!

English Sentences: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Suuppa shachchai minjjettiyoosaa geladii? Ordde shachchai doorettidosaakka be7adii?

English Sentences: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani eta meto wodiyaassi, ola wodiyaassinne toora gallassaassi minjja wottaas.

English Sentences: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?
Wolaitta Sentences: Wolqqanttai kiyiyo sohuwaa efiya ogee awan de7ii? Woikko arshsho bagga carkkoi awappe kiyidi carkkii?

English Sentences: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;
Wolaitta Sentences: "Wolqqaama irai wodhdhiyo loossuwaa giigissidaagee, dadaassi ogiyaa kessidaagee oonee?

English Sentences: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi de7enna bazzuwan iraa bukissiyai oonee?

English Sentences: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?
Wolaitta Sentences: Mela bazzoi iraa haattan shuggidi, mul77o maataa mokkanaadan oottidaagee oonee?

English Sentences: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Irau woikko xaazau aawi de7ii?

English Sentences: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
Wolaitta Sentences: Ordde shachchaunne burcce shachchau aaya de7ai?

English Sentences: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.
Wolaitta Sentences: Kinchchoi haattaa shuchchaadan minttees; abbaa haattau bolla baggaakka shachcha kessees.

English Sentences: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Piliyaadisa geetettiya xoolinttetu citaa issippe gattada qachchanau danddayai? Ooriyoona geetettiya xoolinttetu citai qashettido wodoruwaa birshshanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?
Wolaitta Sentences: Citan citan de7iya xoolintteta eta wodiyan wodiyan kessanau danddayai? Wogga Beeriyaanne Qeera Beeriyaa geetettiya xoolinttetu citata issippe kaalettanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?
Wolaitta Sentences: Saloti aqiyo higgiyaa neeni erai? Woikko he higgee sa7an haaranaadan oottanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Di7oi nena muukkanaadan iraa bukissanau, ne qaalaa xoqqu oottada, shaarata azazuutee?

English Sentences: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?
Wolaitta Sentences: Wolqqanttati biidi yiidi, Hekko, ha77i ai oottonii? gaana mala, neeni eta azazanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?
Wolaitta Sentences: Haatta kafuwaayyo aadhdhida eraa, kutto addiyaayyookka akeekaa immidai oonee?

English Sentences: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,
Wolaitta Sentences: Ba eran shaarata qoodanau danddayiyai oonee? Baanaa munaqqidi, urqqa kessidi, minttanau saluwaa shaarata geddi oottidi,

English Sentences: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?
Wolaitta Sentences: haattaa duge tigiyaagee oonee?

English Sentences: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,
Wolaitta Sentences: "Gaammoti ubbai bantta geessuwan geessuwan zin77idaashin woikko zuggidi naagishin, neeni etayyo miyoobaa shankkatada immanau danddayai?

English Sentences: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?
Wolaitta Sentences: Woikko namisetti uttida eta marata kalissanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.
Wolaitta Sentences: Quuroti namisetti bichchaariyo wode, eta maratikka miyoobaa demmanau taayyo, Xoossaayyo, waassiyo wode, etayyo miyoobaa immiyai oonee?

English Sentences: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Deriyan de7iya genessati aude yeliyaakko, neeni erai? Gaarati bannakkidi, bantta marata yeliyo wode be7adii?

English Sentences: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti kunttiiddi, woisa keena aginaa gam77iyaakkonne qassi aude yeliyaakko erai?

English Sentences: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti gulbbatidi, bantta marata yeliyoi audekko erai?

English Sentences: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta marati bazzon diccidi minnoosona; minnidi bantta aayetu achchappe boosona; naa77antto guyye simmokkona.

English Sentences: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Harddiidati yeda daanaadan oottidai oonee? Qashuwaappe eta birshshi yeddidai oonee?

English Sentences: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.
Wolaitta Sentences: Etau taani bazzuwaa de7iyoosaa oottada immaas; maxine biittan eti de7anaadan oottaas.

English Sentences: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.
Wolaitta Sentences: Katamaa wocamaappe eti haakkidi de7oosona; laaggiyaageetu waasuwaakka siyokkona.

English Sentences: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti dereta banttau heemettiyo soho oottoosona; hegan miyo mul77o maataa qoroosona.

English Sentences: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Menttai neeyyo oottanau eeno ganddee? Woikko ne gaaxaatan qammaa aqanddee?

English Sentences: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: Goyana mala, neeni a waaxuutee? Woikko kaduwaa goochchanaadan a oottanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni a wolqqaa minotettan ammanettuutee? Ne daafurssiya oosuwaa i oottanaadan, ayyo yegga agguutee?

English Sentences: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?
Wolaitta Sentences: I simmidi yiidi, ne kattaa qoxxiyo ne audiyaayyo shiishshees gaada neeni an ammanettai?

English Sentences: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Yanchchiyaa ba qefiyaa eesuwan qaattausu; shin yanchchee qefeti sanggaanuwaa qefetunne baalletu mala gidokkona.

English Sentences: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,
Wolaitta Sentences: Yanchchiyaa ba phuuphulliyaa biittan phuuphullausu; phuuphullada baanai ho7ettanaadan aggaagausu.

English Sentences: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Tohoi menttana woikko, Bazzo do7ati yedhdhana gaada qoppukku.

English Sentences: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;
Wolaitta Sentences: Marati babaa gidennabaadan qoodada, etau meqettaa iitausu. I daafurai ubbai mela attiyoogee iyyo aibanne milatenna.

English Sentences: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
Wolaitta Sentences: Aissi giikko, taani Xoossai a aadhdhida eratettaa doganaadan oottaas; taani akeekaakka iyyo immabeikke.

English Sentences: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin denddada a woxxiyo wode, banaara naasettiya paraa bollinne paraawaa bolli miiccausu.

English Sentences: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, paratuyyo wolqqaa immidai, woikko paratu morggiyaa gotosho gammaa maizzidai nenee?

English Sentences: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.
Wolaitta Sentences: Parati booliyaadan guppanaadaaninne yashshiya daarettaa eti daaranaadan oottidai nenee?

English Sentences: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.
Wolaitta Sentences: Parati zanggaaran biittaa booddoosona; bantta wolqqankka ufaittoosona; yaatidi ola miishshata gixxidaageetuura gaittanau ola dembbaa piriixoosona.

English Sentences: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yashsha giyoobaa eti mulekka erokkona; eta aibinne daganttenna; eta bolli bisuwaa zaarettiyaakkonne guyye simmokkona.

English Sentences: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta toggiya olanchchati oiqqido ola miishshati phooliiddi, issoi issuwaara gaittidi giirettoosona.

English Sentences: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHin parati paachchuriiddi yashissiiddi, olau sinttau piriixoosona. Malkkataa punettaa cenggurssaa siyiyo wode, co77u giidi eqqanau danddayokkona;

English Sentences: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
Wolaitta Sentences: malkkataa punniyo wode, Hayyashsho! yaagoosona. Olaa peenuwaa haahuwan ekkoosona; ola gadaawati azaziyo azazuwaanne olanchchatu ceequwaa siyoosona.

English Sentences: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Gacee ba qefiyaa tohossi miccidi paallanau danddayanaadan, aadhdhida eratettaa ayyo immidai nenee?

English Sentences: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?
Wolaitta Sentences: Argganttai pude kiyidi, ba keettaa xoqqa deretun keexxanau ne azazuwaa naagii?

English Sentences: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.
Wolaitta Sentences: Argganttai aafuwaa doonan ba keettaa keexxidi de7ees; zaallatu za7otikka ayyo qato gididosona.

English Sentences: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegan uttidi, baayyo miyoobaa wochchees; wochchidi a aifee haahuwaappe demmees.

English Sentences: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.
Wolaitta Sentences: Argganttaa marati suuttaa uyoosona; gauxai de7iyoosan awankka i shiiqees" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Iyyooba hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Iyyoobaa, asi Ubbaa Danddayiya Xoossaara mootettidi, shatimmi erii? Ane Xoossaara mootettiya uri ayyo zaaro" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Iyyoobi zaaridi, hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abeet GODAU, taani pattenna laafa asa; taani neeyyo waata zaaranau danddayiyaanaa? Taani ta doonan ta kushiyaa wottaas.

English Sentences: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani issitoo haasayaas; shin taayyo zaariyoobi baawa. Naa77anttuwaa haasayikke" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, GODAI gotiyaa giddoppe Iyyoobassi hagaadan yaagiis;

English Sentences: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Attumaasadan ne xeessaa gixxa denddada, taani oichchiyoogaa taayyo oda.

English Sentences: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni tana mooranchcha kessana hanai? Neeyyo xillo gidanau, tana worddo kessai?

English Sentences: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
Wolaitta Sentences: Xoossaa wolqqaa mala wolqqai neeyyo de7ii? Xoossai guummiyoogaadan neeni guummanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gidikko, ane ne bonchchuwaaninne gitatettan dendda! Ne puulaanne anggaa maaya!

English Sentences: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ne hanqquwaa teegaa ane tiga; otorettiya asa ubbaa xeellada, ane kaushsha!

English Sentences: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ane loitta xeellada, otorettiya ubbaa yeellaya; iitaa oottiyaageeta ubbaa eti de7iyoosan yedhdha!

English Sentences: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eta ubbaa biittan mooga; duufuwaa duge wottada, eta gordda.

English Sentences: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yaatikko, ne wolqqan neeni xoonanaagaa taani neeyyo markkattana.

English Sentences: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani nena medhdhidoogaadan medhdhido, Bihemoota giyo do7aa ane xeella! I booradan maataa mees.

English Sentences: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.
Wolaitta Sentences: A xeessan de7iya wolqqainne a uluwaa kammida shayaa minotettai keehi daro.

English Sentences: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.
Wolaitta Sentences: A goinai zigaadan sitti gi uttiis; a gediyaa xaphotikka minuwan dooqettidaageeta.

English Sentences: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.
Wolaitta Sentences: A meqettati nahaasiyaa bombbaa mala; a gedeekka birataa hiraqotu mala.

English Sentences: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Xoossai medhdhido meretatu ubbaappe i aadhdhi maalaalissiyaagaa. A Medhdhidaagaappe attin, a xoonanau danddayiyaabi baawa.

English Sentences: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.
Wolaitta Sentences: Do7ai ubbai kaa7iyo deree ayyo miyoobaa mokissees.

English Sentences: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.
Wolaitta Sentences: Agunttai de7iyo mittaa garssan zin77ees; maqqaa giddon torqquwan qosettees.

English Sentences: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Agunttai de7iyo mittati bantta kuwan a genttoosona; shaafaa doonan mokkiya mittati a kammoosona.

English Sentences: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: SHaafai kixxidi goggiyo wodekka dagammenna; Yorddaanoosa SHaafai a som77uwan xarccettiyo wodekka i saro de7ees.

English Sentences: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.
Wolaitta Sentences: A aifiyaa toissidi, a oiqqanau danddayiya asi de7ii? A siiriyaakka piriyaa qaran caddi oiqqanau danddayiyai oonee?

English Sentences: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni Lewaataana giyo miimminttiyaa moliyaa oiqqiyo hinggittan oiqqanau, woikko a inxxarssaa wodoruwan qachchanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
Wolaitta Sentences: A siiriyan dafuwaa gelissanau danddayai? Woikko a gacuwaa hinggittan caddada oiqquutee?

English Sentences: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?
Wolaitta Sentences: I nena, Hayyanaa tana yeddarkkii yaagidi woossanee? Woikko i neeyyo mal77o qaalan haasayanee?

English Sentences: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni a merinau ne ashkkara oottanau, i nenaara maachchaa maacettanee?

English Sentences: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
Wolaitta Sentences: Asi kafuwaara kaa7iyoogaadan, neeni aara kaa7uutee? Woikko a qachchada, ne macca ashkkaratuyyo kaa7anau immuutee?

English Sentences: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?
Wolaitta Sentences: Moliyaa oiqqiyaageeti a waagan palamettiyoonaa? Woikko zal77anchchati a qanxxerettidi baizziyoonaa?

English Sentences: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?
Wolaitta Sentences: Neeni a galbbaa maccaamiyan, a huuphiyaakka philxxuwan caddada qohanau danddayai?

English Sentences: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.
Wolaitta Sentences: Ane a ne kushiyan bochcha; neeni aara baaxetido baaxiyaa hassayada, naa77anttada aara baaxetanau kajjeelakka!

English Sentences: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
Wolaitta Sentences: "He miimminttiyaa oiqqanau kajjeeliyoogee mela; harai attin, a be7ida ubbaikka yashshau kokkorees.

English Sentences: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?
Wolaitta Sentences: I zin77idosaappe a denttanau ooninne xalenna; yaatin, ta sinttan eqqanau danddayiyai oonee?

English Sentences: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
Wolaitta Sentences: Taani kushiyaa zaarana mala, taayyo koiro immidai oonee? Saloppe garssaara de7iyaabai ubbai tabaa.

English Sentences: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Lewaataana gedetubaa, a gita wolqqaabaanne a lo77iya bollaabaa haasayiyoogaa taani aggikke.

English Sentences: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?
Wolaitta Sentences: A galbbaa qaaranau danddayiyai oonee? Birata milatiya a maayuwaa caddanau danddayiyai oonee?

English Sentences: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.
Wolaitta Sentences: Yashshiya achchai de7iyo a manggaagaa pooqqanau danddayiyai oonee?

English Sentences: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.
Wolaitta Sentences: A zokkuwaa galbbai issoi issuwaa bollan doorettidanne shuchchaadan minnida gonddalleta milatees.

English Sentences: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti issoi issuwaayyo keehi matattido gishshau, eta giddoora, harai atto, carkkoikka kanttanau danddayenna.

English Sentences: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
Wolaitta Sentences: Eti ubbaikka issoi issuwaara gaitti uttido gishshau, eta aibinne shaakkenna.

English Sentences: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
Wolaitta Sentences: "I hedhdhishiyo wode, pholqqu giya poo7oi kiyees; a aifetikka maallado xalqqiyaadan zo77oosona.

English Sentences: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
Wolaitta Sentences: A doonaappe tamaa lacoi kiyees; tamaikka piridi wodhdhees.

English Sentences: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
Wolaitta Sentences: Penttiya disttiyaappe garssa baggaara eexxiya maqqaappe kiyiya cuwaadan, a siiriyaappe cuwai kiyees.

English Sentences: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.
Wolaitta Sentences: A siiriyaara kiyiya shemppoi xiixinttaa bonqqissees; tamaa lacoikka a doonaappe kiyees.

English Sentences: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
Wolaitta Sentences: "A morggiyan wolqqai de7iyo gishshau, i keehippe yashshiyaagaa.

English Sentences: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.
Wolaitta Sentences: A ashoi issippe nuketti uttido gishshau, a bollai birataadan minnees.

English Sentences: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.
Wolaitta Sentences: A wozanai shuchchaadan mino; gaacciyo woxaadankka mino.

English Sentences: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.
Wolaitta Sentences: I denddiyo wode, minotikka yayyoosona; eti dagammidi baqatoosona.

English Sentences: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.
Wolaitta Sentences: Akko gakkiya bisoi ainne allaalle kessenna; toorai, woikko zubbee, woikko philxxoi a ainne oottenna.

English Sentences: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.
Wolaitta Sentences: Birataa i daladan, nahaasiyaakka musida mittaadan qoodees.

English Sentences: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.
Wolaitta Sentences: Wonddafiyaa zubbee a baqatissenna; yambbarshshan oliyo shuchchaikka ayyo suulla mala.

English Sentences: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.
Wolaitta Sentences: Dullai ayyo issi buuxa mala; tooraa xonggiyo wode, qilliiccidi miiccees.

English Sentences: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.
Wolaitta Sentences: A uluwaa bollan de7iya galbbai meqerettida kon77aadan qara; urqqaara i biyo wode, marashaadan biittaa phalqqees.

English Sentences: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Abbaa penttida haattaadan bukkees; xaaro giddon penttiya zaitiyaadankka bulibulissees.

English Sentences: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baappe guyyeera phooliya ogiyaa kessees; abbaa haattaakka bootta hoommuwau laammees.

English Sentences: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.
Wolaitta Sentences: Biittaa bollan a mala mereti baawa; i yayyi erenna mereta.

English Sentences: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
Wolaitta Sentences: Keehippe gita gidida meretata ubbaa i ziqqi oottidi xeellees; do7a ubbatussi i kawo" yaagiis.

English Sentences: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Iyyoobi GODAAYYO hagaadan yaagidi zaariis;

English Sentences: I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni ubbabaa oottanau danddayiyoogaanne ne halchchuwaakka halissanau danddayiyaabi bainnaagaa taani erais.

English Sentences: Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefore have I uttered that I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.
Wolaitta Sentences: Laa ha eri bainnan ta zoriyaa genttiyaagee oonee? yaagada tana oichchadasa. Tumuppe taani taayyo gelibeennabaa haasayaas; ta eraappe haakkida maalaalissiyaabaa haasayaas.

English Sentences: Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Neeni tana, Taani yootiyo wode ezgga; taani oichchiyo wode oda yaagadasa.

English Sentences: I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.
Wolaitta Sentences: "Taani kase nebaa ta haittan siyaas; shin ha77i ta aifiyan nena be7aas.

English Sentences: Wherefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, taani haasayidobai tana yeellayiis. Yaatin, taani bidinttaaninne baanan uttada paaxais" yaagiis.

English Sentences: And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words unto Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI hagaa Iyyoobassi haasayidoogaappe guyyiyan, Temaanappe yiida Elifaaza hagaadan yaagiis; "Ta ashkkaraa Iyyoobadan, intte tabaa likke haasayibeenna gishshau, ne bollinne ne naa77u laggetu bolli ta hanqqoi eexxi kiyiis.

English Sentences: Therefore take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal with you after your folly, in that ye have not spoken of me the thing which is right, like my servant Job.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaa gishshau, ha77i laappun korimatanne laappun dorssa orggeta ekkidi, ta ashkkaraa Iyyoobakko biite; biidi xuuggiyo yarshshuwaa intte mooruwaassi yarshshite. Ta ashkkarai Iyyoobi intteyyo woossana; taanikka a woosaa siyada, intte mooruwaadan qaxxayikke. Aissi giikko, intte ta ashkkaraa Iyyoobadan tabaa likke haasayibeekketa" yaagiis.

English Sentences: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the LORD commanded them: the LORD also accepted Job.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, Temaanappe yiida Elifaazi, SHuuhappe yiida Bilddaadinne Naa7imappe yiida Xoofaari biidi, GODAI eta azazidoogaadan oottidosona. GODAIKKA Iyyooba woosaa siyiis.

English Sentences: And the LORD turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobi ba laggetuyyo woossidoogaappe guyyiyan, GODAI ayyo zaaridi ishalissiis; ayyo kaseegaa gishshaa naa77u kushe oottidi immiis.

English Sentences: Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him over all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an earring of gold.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe guyyiyan, a ishati, a michchetinne kase a eriyaageeti ubbati akko yiidosona; yiidi a son aara gibiraa miidosona. Ayyo azzanidi, GODAI a bolli ehiido meto ubbaappe a minttettidosona. Qassi ubbaikka ayyo worqqa migiduwaanne biraa immidosona.

English Sentences: So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.
Wolaitta Sentences: GODAI Iyyooba wurssetta laittaa koiro laittaappe aattidi anjjiis. Iyyoobayyo tammanne oiddu sha7u dorssati, usuppun sha7u gaameelati, issi sha7u waaxa booratinne issi sha7u macca hareti de7oosona.

English Sentences: He had also seven sons and three daughters.
Wolaitta Sentences: Qassi ayyo laappun attuma naatinne heezzu macca naati yelettidosona.

English Sentences: And he called the name of the first, Jemima; and the name of the second, Kezia; and the name of the third, Kerenhappuch.
Wolaitta Sentences: Baira macca na7iyo Yimiimo, naa77anttiyo Qaxii7o, heezzanttiyo Qerenihafuuko yaagidi sunttiis.

English Sentences: And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyooba macca naatudan mera lo77o macca asi biittan sa7an awaaninne beettenna. Eta aawai etayyo eta ishatuura laattiyo biittaa shaakkidi immiis.

English Sentences: After this lived Job an hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, even four generations.
Wolaitta Sentences: Hegaappe simmin, Iyyoobi xeetanne oitamu laittaa de7iis; ba naatanne ba naatu naata oiddantto yeletaa gakkanaashin be7iis.

English Sentences: So Job died, being old and full of days.
Wolaitta Sentences: Iyyoobi daro wodiyaa de7idi, lo77o cimaa cimidi haiqqiis.
